PERCENT.Location: In neutral space on the dominant side.
PERCENT.Movement: The hand moves down and then horizontally across to trace a shape in the air.
PERCENT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a percentage or proportion.

INJECT.Handshape: Dominant hand; modified L-Handshape (thumb and index finger form a pincer).
INJECT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side.
INJECT.Location: The non-dominant arm is held out, with the target area being the upper arm.
INJECT.Movement: The dominant hand's fingertips move to the non-dominant bicep, and the thumb presses down.
INJECT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May include a slight wince. Represents a shot, vaccine, or injection.

ACCIDENT.Movement: Both hands move inward and strike each other firmly at the knuckles.
ACCIDENT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Surprised expression, mouth open. Represents an unforeseen event or collision.

WATER.Handshape: Dominant hand; W-Handshape (index, middle, and ring fingers extended).
WATER.Movement: The index finger of the hand repeatedly taps the chin.
WATER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the clear liquid H2O.

SCREWDRIVER1.Handshape: Dominant hand; H-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
SCREWDRIVER1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SCREWDRIVER1.Location: In front of the body, with the dominant hand's fingertips on the non-dominant palm.
SCREWDRIVER1.Movement: The dominant hand twists back and forth from the wrist.
SCREWDRIVER1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression, focused eyes. Conceptually represents a tool used for turning screws.

PROVIDE.Handshape: Both hands; flat O-Handshapes (fingers and thumbs are curved and touching).
PROVIDE.Location: Starts close to the body at chest level.
PROVIDE.Movement: Both hands move forward and slightly upward in an arc.
PROVIDE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, open expression. Represents the act of giving, supplying, or offering.

PLAN.Orientation: Palms face each other, fingertips point forward.
PLAN.Location: Starts on one side of the body in neutral space.
PLAN.Movement: Both hands move together smoothly in a horizontal line to the other side of the body.
PLAN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused, thoughtful expression. Represents a strategy, schedule, or intention.

PLATE.Handshape: Both hands; L-Handshapes with curved index fingers.
PLATE.Orientation: Fingertips point toward each other, palms angled down.
PLATE.Movement: The hands start apart and move in arcs towards each other to outline a circle.
PLATE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a flat dish used for holding food.

ACCENT.Location: The fingertip starts at the side of the throat.
ACCENT.Movement: The hand moves forward and away from the body.
ACCENT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a distinct mode of pronunciation.

BEE1.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an F-Handshape and transitions to a B-Handshape.
BEE1.Location: At the side of the mouth on the cheek.
BEE1.Movement: The F-Handshape touches the cheek, then the hand moves away while opening and brushing with the fingertips.
BEE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific type of flying insect.

TURNKEY.Handshape: Dominant hand; K-Handshape (index and middle fingers point up, thumb on middle finger).
TURNKEY.Location: In neutral space in front of the body.
TURNKEY.Movement: The hand twists at the wrist as if turning a key in a lock.
TURNKEY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents the action of using a key.

TOUGH.Handshape: Both hands; bent V-Handshapes (index and middle fingers are bent).
TOUGH.Orientation: Palms face inward, toward each other.
TOUGH.Movement: The dominant hand starts behind the stationary non-dominant hand and moves forward in a sharp arc.
TOUGH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Tense, firm facial expression, tense muscles. Represents strength or difficulty.

WALLET.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces up.
WALLET.Movement: The dominant hand, hinged at the wrist on the non-dominant palm, taps down twice.
WALLET.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a small case for holding money and cards.

WORSE.Handshape: Both hands; K-Handshapes (index and middle fingers point up, thumb on middle finger).
WORSE.Movement: The hands start apart and move together, crossing forcefully at the wrists.
WORSE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Negative facial expression, such as a frown or grimace. Represents a lower quality.

ONEYEARAGO.Handshape: Starts with both hands in S-Handshapes, transitions to dominant Index-Handshape.
ONEYEARAGO.Location: In front of the body, then the dominant hand moves back over the shoulder.
ONEYEARAGO.Movement: The dominant fist circles forward around the stationary non-dominant fist, then the dominant hand points back over the shoulder.
ONEYEARAGO.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression, head may tilt back slightly. Represents the time period of twelve months in the past.

BREAKDOWN1.Handshape: Both hands; clawed 5-Handshapes with fingers loosely interlocked.
BREAKDOWN1.Orientation: Palms face each other or slightly down.
BREAKDOWN1.Movement: The hands, with fingers interlocked, move down abruptly a short distance and may shake slightly.
BREAKDOWN1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Frustrated facial expression. Represents a machine or vehicle ceasing to function.

AGENCY.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
AGENCY.Movement: The hands make alternating forward circles as they move forward together.
AGENCY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an organization or business that provides a service.

EVERYDAY.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape (fist with thumb alongside).
EVERYDAY.Orientation: The thumb-side of the fist is against the cheek.
EVERYDAY.Location: On the cheek, near the jawline.
EVERYDAY.Movement: The hand brushes backward along the cheekbone in several short, repeated motions.
EVERYDAY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents something that is daily, common, or routine.

SOON1.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch, forming a circle).
SOON1.Movement: The hand moves back and forth in a short, repeated motion against the chin.
SOON1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Cheeks may be slightly puffed. Represents a short time in the future.

SNORKEL.Handshape: Dominant hand; G-Handshape (thumb and index finger extended parallel).
SNORKEL.Movement: The hand starts at the mouth and moves up and back toward the side of the head.
SNORKEL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a tube used for breathing underwater.

SENATE.Location: Starts at the dominant side of the chest.
SENATE.Movement: The hand moves in a straight horizontal line to the other side of the chest.
SENATE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Formal, neutral expression. Represents a legislative body.

PLAYERS.Handshape: Both hands; Y-Handshapes transition to B-Handshapes.
PLAYERS.Orientation: Y-Hand palms face each other. B-Hand palms face each other.
PLAYERS.Location: In front of the body for the first part, then at the sides of the body.
PLAYERS.Movement: First, the Y-hands twist back and forth, then the flat hands move straight down the sides of the torso.
PLAYERS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents participants in a game or sport.

SOCIALIZE.Location: In front of the body, spread apart.
SOCIALIZE.Movement: The hands move in large alternating circles toward and away from each other.
SOCIALIZE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleasant, interactive expression. Represents interacting within a group.

ALITTLEBIT.Handshape: Dominant hand; G-Handshape (thumb and index finger extended parallel).
ALITTLEBIT.Movement: The thumb and index finger flick together, showing a very small amount.
ALITTLEBIT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Squinted eyes, pursed lips. Represents a small quantity.

HINGE.Handshape: Both hands; H-Handshapes (index and middle fingers extended).
HINGE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down; non-dominant palm faces up.
HINGE.Movement: The fingertips of the hands touch, and the dominant hand pivots up and down from the knuckles.
HINGE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a jointed mechanism.

DOUBLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
DOUBLE.Orientation: Dominant palm starts facing down, flips to face up. Non-dominant palm faces up.
DOUBLE.Location: The dominant hand is on the non-dominant palm.
DOUBLE.Movement: The dominant hand's fingertips touch the palm, then the hand flips over so the back of the fingers touch the palm.
DOUBLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents two of something or to multiply by two.

RESIGN.Handshape: Dominant hand; H-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
RESIGN.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side, forming an opening.
RESIGN.Movement: The dominant hand starts inside the opening of the non-dominant hand and moves up and out.
RESIGN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Firm, decisive expression. Represents voluntarily leaving a position.

OPPORTUNITY.Handshape: Both hands; start as O-Handshapes and transition to P-Handshapes.
OPPORTUNITY.Location: In front of the body at chest level.
OPPORTUNITY.Movement: Both hands move upward in arcs while changing from the first handshape to the second.
OPPORTUNITY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Hopeful, positive expression. Represents a chance or favorable time to do something.

MOTIVATION1.Movement: The hands rub back and forth against each other in a circular or linear motion.
MOTIVATION1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Energetic, eager expression. Represents a reason for action or a drive to succeed.

ABBREVIATE.Handshape: Both hands; bent V-Handshapes (index and middle fingers are bent).
ABBREVIATE.Location: In front of the body, starting apart.
ABBREVIATE.Movement: The hands move toward each other until the knuckles of the bent fingers touch firmly.
ABBREVIATE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of shortening a word or phrase.

GOOSEBUMPS.Handshape: Dominant hand; clawed 5-Handshape. Non-dominant arm is held out.
GOOSEBUMPS.Orientation: Palm faces inward toward the non-dominant arm.
GOOSEBUMPS.Movement: The fingertips of the dominant hand move up the non-dominant arm from the wrist to the shoulder as the fingers wiggle.
GOOSEBUMPS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May be accompanied by a shiver. Represents bumps on the skin from cold, fear, or excitement.

GUILLOTINE1.Location: At the back of the neck.
GUILLOTINE1.Movement: The hand makes a short, sharp downward chopping motion toward the back of the neck.
GUILLOTINE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Head may jerk forward slightly. Represents a device for beheading or being fired.

TRANSFER.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape (index and middle fingers are bent).
TRANSFER.Location: In neutral space in front of the body.
TRANSFER.Movement: The hand starts at one point and moves in an arc to another point.
TRANSFER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of moving something from one place to another.

TURTLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; cupped B-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; A-Handshape.
TURTLE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
TURTLE.Movement: The dominant hand covers the non-dominant fist, and the non-dominant thumb wiggles back and forth.
TURTLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a slow-moving reptile with a shell.

WANDER.Movement: The hand moves forward in a meandering, wavy, or zigzag path.
WANDER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Casual, relaxed expression. Represents walking or moving in a leisurely or aimless way.

NEUTRAL.Handshape: Dominant hand; N-Handshape (index and middle fingers draped over the thumb).
NEUTRAL.Location: In neutral space in front of the dominant shoulder.
NEUTRAL.Movement: The hand shakes back and forth from the wrist.
NEUTRAL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A flat, unemotional facial expression. Represents being impartial or having no strong opinion.

NECKLACE1.Orientation: Palms face down, fingertips point toward each other.
NECKLACE1.Location: At the upper chest, near the collarbones.
NECKLACE1.Movement: The hands start apart and move in an arc toward each other, tracing the shape of the jewelry.
NECKLACE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a piece of jewelry worn around the neck.

ROLLERSKATING.Handshape: Both hands; bent V-Handshapes (index and middle fingers are bent).
ROLLERSKATING.Location: In front of the body at waist level.
ROLLERSKATING.Movement: The hands move forward and back in a smooth, alternating motion.
ROLLERSKATING.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body may sway side to side. Represents moving on footwear with wheels.

PSYCHOLOGIST.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces inward, hand held vertically.
PSYCHOLOGIST.Movement: The pinky-edge of the dominant hand chops into the space between the thumb and index finger of the non-dominant hand.
PSYCHOLOGIST.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, analytical expression. Represents a professional in the field of mental science.

ELECTRICIAN.Handshape: Both hands; bent X-Handshapes (index fingers are bent).
ELECTRICIAN.Movement: The knuckles of the bent index fingers rub or tap together repeatedly.
ELECTRICIAN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a person who works with electrical wiring.

HOMEWORK.Handshape: First part: flat O-Handshape. Second part: two S-Handshapes.
HOMEWORK.Orientation: First part: palm inward. Second part: dominant palm down.
HOMEWORK.Location: First at the cheek/jaw, then in front of the body.
HOMEWORK.Movement: The flat O-hand taps the cheek then the jawline. Then, the dominant fist taps the wrist of the non-dominant fist.
HOMEWORK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or slightly stressed expression. Represents schoolwork assigned to be done outside of class.

SALAD.Orientation: Palms face up and are angled toward each other.
SALAD.Location: In front of the body, as if holding a bowl.
SALAD.Movement: The hands move upward in alternating circular motions.
SALAD.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Conceptually represents tossing a dish of mixed vegetables.

BRUSH.Location: Near the hair on the side of the head.
BRUSH.Movement: The hand moves down the side of the head in two or three short, repeated strokes.
BRUSH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of grooming hair with a tool.

DEVIL.Handshape: Both hands; '3' handshape with the thumb extended forward.
DEVIL.Location: The thumbs are placed at the temples.
DEVIL.Movement: The index and middle fingers bend down and straighten up a couple of times simultaneously.
DEVIL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Mischievous or evil facial expression. Represents a malevolent being with horns.

BAG1.Location: At the side of the body, near the waist.
BAG1.Movement: The hand moves up and down slightly from the wrist in a short, repeated motion.
BAG1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of carrying a flexible container.

CURTAIN.Orientation: Palms face forward, fingertips point up.
CURTAIN.Location: In front of the body at eye level.
CURTAIN.Movement: The hands start together with the index fingers touching and move apart horizontally.
CURTAIN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a piece of material suspended as a screen, like in a window or theater.

SHORTS.Location: At the sides of the upper thighs.
SHORTS.Movement: The hands brush down the thighs a short distance simultaneously and may slap them once at the end.
SHORTS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents short trousers ending above the knee.

VERB.Movement: The hands start near the body and move forward in an alternating pattern.
VERB.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a word denoting an action, occurrence, or state of being.

CALENDAR1.Handshape: Dominant hand; 4-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
CALENDAR1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces forward.
CALENDAR1.Movement: The dominant hand moves down and across the non-dominant palm, as if outlining a grid.
CALENDAR1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a chart showing days, weeks, and months.

MOUNTAIN1.Handshape: Both hands; start as S-Handshapes (fists) and become loose 5-Handshapes.
MOUNTAIN1.Location: Starts low in front of the body.
MOUNTAIN1.Movement: The hands move up in a jagged path, sometimes tapping each other, then move out to the sides.
MOUNTAIN1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a large natural elevation of the earth's surface.

HEAVEN.Orientation: Palms face each other, then the non-dominant palm faces down.
HEAVEN.Location: Starts low and moves above the head.
HEAVEN.Movement: The hands circle each other as they rise, then the dominant hand passes through the non-dominant hand, which is held flat.
HEAVEN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes look up, peaceful expression. Represents the sky or a spiritual realm above.

EGG.Handshape: Both hands; H-Handshapes (index and middle fingers extended).
EGG.Movement: The hands start with index and middle fingers touching, then move down and apart in small arcs.
EGG.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an oval reproductive body laid by female birds.

BRIDGE1.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape. Non-dominant arm is held horizontally.
BRIDGE1.Movement: The fingertips of the dominant hand touch the wrist and then the elbow of the non-dominant arm.
BRIDGE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a structure built to span an obstacle.

SPEAKERS.Orientation: Palms are angled forward and toward each other.
SPEAKERS.Location: At the sides of the mouth.
SPEAKERS.Movement: Both hands move forward and outward in arcs, sometimes with wiggling fingers.
SPEAKERS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents devices that produce sound.

ALPHABET.Handshape: Dominant hand; transitions through the handshapes for 'A' and 'B' and 'C'.
ALPHABET.Location: In neutral space in front of the shoulder.
ALPHABET.Movement: The hand moves slightly to the side between each letter sign.
ALPHABET.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the set of letters used in a language.

CIGAR.Handshape: Dominant hand; R-Handshape (index and middle fingers crossed).
CIGAR.Location: At the corner of the mouth.
CIGAR.Movement: The hand is held stationary at the mouth.
CIGAR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a roll of dried tobacco leaf for smoking.

THIEF1.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape (index and middle fingers are bent).
THIEF1.Orientation: Palm faces inward, fingertips point to the side.
THIEF1.Movement: The back of the dominant hand's fingers brushes back and forth under the nose.
THIEF1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sly, shifty-eyed expression. Represents a person who steals.

CHARACTER.Location: Over the heart area on the left side of the chest.
CHARACTER.Movement: The hand moves in a small vertical circle over the heart.
CHARACTER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the mental and moral qualities distinctive to an individual.

TEXT.Handshape: Both hands; thumbs are extended, other fingers hold an imaginary device.
TEXT.Orientation: Palms face each other, angled up.
TEXT.Location: In front of the body at waist level.
TEXT.Movement: The thumbs move up and down alternately, as if typing on a smartphone screen.
TEXT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes look down. Represents sending a written message on a mobile phone.

ZOOMIN.Handshape: Both hands; L-Handshapes (thumb and index finger extended).
ZOOMIN.Orientation: Dominant palm faces forward; non-dominant palm faces inward.
ZOOMIN.Location: In front of the face, with the non-dominant hand closer to the body.
ZOOMIN.Movement: The dominant hand starts further away and moves toward the non-dominant hand.
ZOOMIN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes may squint. Represents magnifying a view or image.

DECIDE1.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes (thumb and index finger touch).
DECIDE1.Movement: Both hands start near the forehead and move down together in a sharp, decisive motion, ending in front of the body.
DECIDE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Firm, determined facial expression. Represents the action of making a choice.

TOURNAMENT.Handshape: Both hands; bent V-Handshapes (index and middle fingers are bent).
TOURNAMENT.Location: In front of the body, held to the sides.
TOURNAMENT.Movement: The hands move toward the center and then back out in opposition, repeatedly.
TOURNAMENT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Competitive expression. Represents a series of contests between competitors.

WASTE.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
WASTE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
WASTE.Movement: The back of the dominant hand starts at the heel of the non-dominant palm and flicks upward off the fingertips repeatedly.
WASTE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Negative facial expression. Represents using something carelessly or to no purpose.

GRAPES1.Handshape: Dominant hand; clawed 5-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
GRAPES1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces down.
GRAPES1.Location: On the back of the non-dominant hand.
GRAPES1.Movement: The dominant hand makes several short, bouncing motions down the back of the non-dominant hand from wrist to knuckles.
GRAPES1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a bunch of a specific type of fruit.

SECRETARY.Handshape: Dominant hand; K-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
SECRETARY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SECRETARY.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the mouth, then moves down to draw a line across the non-dominant palm.
SECRETARY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an administrative professional.

MCDONALDS.Location: In neutral space on the dominant side of the body.
MCDONALDS.Movement: The hand moves up and down in two connected arcs, tracing the shape of an arch.
MCDONALDS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific brand of fast-food restaurant.

PICTURE.Handshape: Dominant hand; C-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape held vertically.
PICTURE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
PICTURE.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the eye, then moves forward to land on the non-dominant palm.
PICTURE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a photograph, image, or illustration.

IMPOSSIBLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; Y-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
IMPOSSIBLE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
IMPOSSIBLE.Movement: The dominant hand repeatedly strikes the non-dominant palm with the bottom of the fist.
IMPOSSIBLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Negative headshake, firm or frustrated expression. Represents something that cannot be done.

CORN1.Location: At the corner of the mouth.
CORN1.Movement: The hand twists back and forth from the wrist as it moves horizontally across the mouth.
CORN1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific grain, often as if eating it from the cob.

STRICT.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape (index and middle fingers are bent).
STRICT.Movement: The knuckles of the bent fingers tap firmly on the bridge of the nose.
STRICT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Stern, unyielding facial expression. Represents demanding that rules are obeyed without exception.

KNIFE1.Orientation: The dominant palm faces down; the non-dominant palm faces up.
KNIFE1.Movement: The side of the dominant index finger slides back and forth across the side of the non-dominant index finger.
KNIFE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a cutting utensil or the action of sharpening a blade.

QUIET.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingers point up.
QUIET.Location: Starts with hands crossed in front of the mouth.
QUIET.Movement: The hands move down and apart to the sides in a smooth motion.
QUIET.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May be accompanied by a 'shhh' sound and pursed lips. Represents an absence of noise.

CENTER.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent 5-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
CENTER.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
CENTER.Movement: The dominant hand moves in a horizontal circle and then the middle fingertip taps the center of the non-dominant palm.
CENTER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the middle point of something.

PILE.Movement: The hands start low and apart, then move up and together to trace the shape of a mound.
PILE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a heap of things lying on top of each other.

WIN.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an open 5-Handshape and closes to an S-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; S-Handshape.
WIN.Movement: The dominant hand starts above the stationary non-dominant fist and moves down, closing as it passes.
WIN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Excited, triumphant facial expression. Represents being successful or victorious.

GOVERNMENT.Orientation: Palm faces to the side, fingertip points to the head.
GOVERNMENT.Movement: The hand points to the temple, then moves away while twisting to point up.
GOVERNMENT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, formal expression. Represents the governing body of a nation or state.

MIND.Movement: The fingertip taps the side of the forehead once or twice.
MIND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or thoughtful expression. Represents the faculty of consciousness and thought.

VIOLIN.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; S-Handshape.
VIOLIN.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
VIOLIN.Location: The non-dominant hand is held out. The dominant hand is near the shoulder.
VIOLIN.Movement: The dominant hand moves back and forth in a smooth, horizontal bowing motion.
VIOLIN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Head is tilted, body sways with the rhythm. Represents a specific stringed instrument.

5DOLLARS.Location: In neutral space in front of the dominant shoulder.
5DOLLARS.Movement: The hand twists from the wrist.
5DOLLARS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. This sign incorporates the number and the monetary unit.

RUDE.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
RUDE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
RUDE.Movement: The middle fingertip of the dominant hand starts at the heel of the non-dominant palm and scrapes forward quickly off the fingertips.
RUDE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Harsh, disapproving facial expression. Represents being impolite or ill-mannered.

CAREFUL.Handshape: Both hands; K-Handshapes (index and middle fingers point up, thumb on middle finger).
CAREFUL.Orientation: Non-dominant palm faces right (if right-handed); dominant palm faces left.
CAREFUL.Movement: The dominant hand taps down firmly on top of the stationary non-dominant hand. The movement can be repeated.
CAREFUL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Cautious, alert facial expression, head may nod slightly with the tapping motion. Represents taking care to avoid danger.

INVITE.Location: Starts out to the side of the body.
INVITE.Movement: The hand moves in an arc from the side toward the center of the body.
INVITE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A smile and an inviting expression. Represents a polite request for someone's presence.

HOSPITAL1.Handshape: Dominant hand; H-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
HOSPITAL1.Movement: The hand moves down and then across the bicep, tracing the shape of a cross.
HOSPITAL1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a medical institution for patient care.

COMPLEX.Handshape: Both hands; bent X-Handshapes (index fingers are hooked).
COMPLEX.Movement: The hands start apart, move together with fingers interlinking, pull apart, and repeat the motion from different angles.
COMPLEX.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Confused or complex facial expression, furrowed brow. Represents intricacy or difficulty.

PIPE1.Handshape: Dominant hand; Y-Handshape with bent thumb and pinky.
PIPE1.Location: At the corner of the mouth.
PIPE1.Movement: The hand is held stationary at the mouth.
PIPE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a tube with a bowl at one end, used for smoking.

ACTION.Movement: The hands move forward and back in an alternating, energetic motion.
ACTION.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Active, energetic expression. Represents the process of doing something.

TEMPTATION.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant arm is bent across the body.
TEMPTATION.Location: At the elbow of the non-dominant arm.
TEMPTATION.Movement: The dominant index finger taps the elbow repeatedly.
TEMPTATION.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sly or conflicted facial expression. Represents the desire to do something, especially something wrong or unwise.

SUSPECT.Movement: The hand moves back and forth, scratching the forehead with the bent index finger.
SUSPECT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Squinted eyes, uncertain expression, furrowed brow. Represents suspicion or doubt.

ALARM.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Then both hands become clawed 5-hands.
ALARM.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down; non-dominant palm faces up. Then both palms face outward.
ALARM.Movement: The dominant index finger strikes the non-dominant palm, then both hands move to the sides and shake vigorously.
ALARM.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Surprised or urgent expression. Represents a warning sound or device.

THAT.Handshape: Dominant hand; Y-Handshape (thumb and pinky extended).
THAT.Location: In neutral space in front of the body.
THAT.Movement: The hand makes a short, sharp downward and forward motion.
THAT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A definite nod or glance. Represents a specific thing previously mentioned or indicated.

EGYPT.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
EGYPT.Orientation: Palm faces inward, toward the forehead.
EGYPT.Location: At the center of the forehead.
EGYPT.Movement: The hand is held stationary at the forehead.
EGYPT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific country in North Africa.

WHY.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as a B-Handshape and transitions to a Y-Handshape.
WHY.Location: Starts with fingertips at the forehead.
WHY.Movement: The hand starts at the forehead and moves down and away, ending with the middle fingers bent down.
WHY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyebrows are furrowed. Represents a question asking for a reason or explanation.

9OCLOCK.Location: In neutral space, near the non-dominant wrist.
9OCLOCK.Movement: The dominant hand is held in its handshape and shakes slightly from the wrist, which may be supported by the non-dominant hand.
9OCLOCK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific time on the hour.

LIGHTER.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended.
LIGHTER.Movement: The thumb flicks upward once or twice, as if using a flint-wheel.
LIGHTER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a portable device used to create a flame.

CHANNEL.Movement: The dominant hand brushes forward past the stationary non-dominant hand.
CHANNEL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a band of frequencies for media transmission.

COCACOLA.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent L-Handshape (thumb and index finger bent).
COCACOLA.Movement: The thumb of the dominant hand jabs into the bicep twice.
COCACOLA.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific brand of carbonated soft drink.

FRAUD.Location: At the side of the nose.
FRAUD.Movement: The index finger brushes forward past the side of the nose.
FRAUD.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Deceitful or sly expression. Represents wrongful or criminal deception.

ZOOMOFF.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an L-Handshape and closes to an X-Handshape.
ZOOMOFF.Movement: The hand moves away from the body quickly while changing handshape.
ZOOMOFF.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents leaving suddenly and quickly.

ADDRESS.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
ADDRESS.Movement: The hands move up the sides of the chest in a repeated motion.
ADDRESS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the location details of a residence or organization.

SMILE1.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point toward the mouth.
SMILE1.Location: At the corners of the mouth.
SMILE1.Movement: The hands start at the corners of the mouth and move up and out in arcs, tracing the shape of a grin.
SMILE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A pleasant, happy facial expression. Represents forming one's features into a pleased or amused expression.

FLOOR.Location: Low in neutral space, at about waist level.
FLOOR.Movement: The hands start together in front of the body and move apart horizontally.
FLOOR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the lower surface of a room.

HOPE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward; non-dominant palm faces down.
HOPE.Location: At the side of the forehead.
HOPE.Movement: The dominant hand starts above the non-dominant hand, and both bend down from the knuckles twice.
HOPE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Hopeful, expectant facial expression. Represents a feeling of expectation and desire.

SAW1.Handshape: Dominant hand; S-Handshape (a fist). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
SAW1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
SAW1.Movement: The dominant hand moves back and forth in a repeated motion across the edge of the non-dominant hand.
SAW1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Shows effort. Represents a tool for cutting wood or other hard materials.

CONFIDENT.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as a clawed 5-Handshape and closes to an S-handshape.
CONFIDENT.Movement: The hand starts at the chest and moves forward in a strong, deliberate motion while closing.
CONFIDENT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Confident, proud expression, chest may be puffed out. Represents a feeling of self-assurance.

NOTINTERESTED.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts with middle finger and thumb touching, then opens and twists.
NOTINTERESTED.Orientation: Starts with palm inward, then twists to palm outward.
NOTINTERESTED.Location: Starts at the chest or nose.
NOTINTERESTED.Movement: The hand starts near the body, moves forward, and twists with a flick of the wrist, opening the hand.
NOTINTERESTED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Disinterested expression, head may shake. Represents a lack of curiosity or concern.

CONTACT.Handshape: Both hands; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward.
CONTACT.Movement: The middle fingertips of both hands move together and touch firmly.
CONTACT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the state of physical touching or communication.

ALCOHOL.Handshape: Both hands; Y-Handshapes (thumb and pinky extended).
ALCOHOL.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
ALCOHOL.Movement: The dominant pinky taps the non-dominant thumb.
ALCOHOL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents drinks such as wine, beer, and spirits.

SCULPTURE.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes with thumbs extended.
SCULPTURE.Movement: The thumbs of the hands move down the sides of the opposite fist in alternating carving motions.
SCULPTURE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Artistic, focused expression. Represents the art of making three-dimensional forms.

LAMP1.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as a flat O-Handshape and opens to a clawed 5-Handshape.
LAMP1.Movement: The hand starts closed and then the fingers spread open, representing light shining down.
LAMP1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a device for giving light.

CONNECTION.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes, but with index and thumb forming a link rather than a circle.
CONNECTION.Movement: The thumb and index finger of each hand link together and pull back and forth slightly.
CONNECTION.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a relationship or link between people or things.

BACKOUT.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
BACKOUT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
BACKOUT.Movement: The dominant index finger starts inside the non-dominant C-hand and pulls out backward.
BACKOUT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Negative headshake. Represents withdrawing from a commitment or promise.

FILTER.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; open 5-handshape.
FILTER.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces down.
FILTER.Movement: The dominant hand moves down, passing slowly through the spread fingers of the stationary non-dominant hand.
FILTER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents passing a substance through a device to remove unwanted material.

PSYCHOLOGY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces inward, hand held vertically.
PSYCHOLOGY.Movement: The pinky-edge of the dominant hand chops into the space between the thumb and index finger of the non-dominant hand.
PSYCHOLOGY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, analytical expression. Represents the scientific study of the human mind.

FLUTE.Handshape: Both hands; modified X-handshapes (fingers are curved as if holding the instrument).
FLUTE.Location: At the mouth, with hands extending to the dominant side.
FLUTE.Movement: The fingers wiggle up and down as if pressing keys.
FLUTE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Cheeks may be puffed. Represents a specific woodwind instrument.

BIB.Movement: The hands start at the top of the chest and trace the outline of a bib down and toward the center.
BIB.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a garment worn to protect clothing from spilled food.

COOL2.Location: The thumb is placed on the upper chest.
COOL2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A calm, suave, or self-satisfied expression. Represents being fashionably attractive or impressive.

CLICK.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward.
CLICK.Movement: The middle finger moves down in a short, sharp motion, as if pressing a computer mouse button.
CLICK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents making a short, sharp sound or pressing a button.

OVERLOOK.Movement: The hand moves down in front of the face without touching, representing a view from above or missing something.
OVERLOOK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents failing to notice something.

BEANIE.Location: Start at the top of the head.
BEANIE.Movement: The hands move down the sides of the head simultaneously, as if pulling on a cap.
BEANIE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a close-fitting brimless cap.

NOON1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces down.
NOON1.Movement: The dominant arm is held straight up, with the elbow resting on the back of the horizontal non-dominant hand.
NOON1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents twelve o'clock in the daytime.

PERFUME2.Handshape: Dominant hand; modified X-handshape with thumb extended (a fist with thumb on top of index finger).
PERFUME2.Location: Held near the neck or wrist.
PERFUME2.Movement: The thumb presses down twice, as if spraying from an atomizer bottle.
PERFUME2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May be accompanied by a sniffing motion. Represents a fragrant liquid.

BLOOM.Handshape: Both hands; start as flat O-Handshapes and open to clawed 5-Handshapes.
BLOOM.Movement: The hands start together with fingertips touching, then open up and move apart slowly.
BLOOM.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleasant, gentle expression. Represents a flower opening or something developing beautifully.

SPITOUT.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an S-Handshape and opens to a 5-Handshape.
SPITOUT.Orientation: Palm starts inward and turns forward.
SPITOUT.Movement: The hand moves forward away from the mouth while the fingers flick open.
SPITOUT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Disgusted expression, puffed cheeks. Represents ejecting something from the mouth.

ACCORDION.Movement: The dominant hand is held steady while the non-dominant hand moves in and out from the side.
ACCORDION.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body sways with the rhythm. Represents a specific box-shaped musical instrument.

SIDEBURNS.Handshape: Both hands; G-Handshapes (thumb and index finger extended parallel).
SIDEBURNS.Location: At the sides of the face, near the ears.
SIDEBURNS.Movement: The hands move straight down the sides of the face a short distance.
SIDEBURNS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents strips of hair grown down the sides of a man's face.

BIG.Handshape: Both hands; L-Handshapes, bent (index finger and thumb are bent).
BIG.Movement: The hands start close together and move apart horizontally.
BIG.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Puffed cheeks ('cha' mouth morpheme). Represents something of considerable size or extent.

WEWILLSEE.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
WEWILLSEE.Location: Starts with fingertips near the eye.
WEWILLSEE.Movement: The hand moves forward from the eye in a straight line.
WEWILLSEE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Thoughtful, knowing, or challenging expression. Represents a statement of future observation or consequence.

OVERWHELMED.Location: Start at the sides of the body.
OVERWHELMED.Movement: The hands move up and forward in a large wave-like motion that passes over the head.
OVERWHELMED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Overwhelmed facial expression, eyes may be wide. Represents being buried by a huge mass.

ROCKINGCHAIR1.Handshape: Both hands; '3' Handshapes (thumb, index, and middle fingers extended).
ROCKINGCHAIR1.Movement: The hands move forward and back in unison with a smooth, rocking motion.
ROCKINGCHAIR1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body may rock with the movement. Represents a chair mounted on rockers.

DIRECTOR.Handshape: Both hands; Index-Handshapes, then transition to B-Handshapes.
DIRECTOR.Orientation: Index palms face each other, fingers point up. B-Hand palms face each other.
DIRECTOR.Location: In front of the chest, then at the sides.
DIRECTOR.Movement: The Index-hands move forward together, then flat hands move straight down the sides of the torso.
DIRECTOR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, formal expression. Represents a person in charge of an organization or activity.

GENERATION.Handshape: Both hands; G-Handshapes (thumb and index finger extended parallel).
GENERATION.Movement: The hands make forward circles, one behind the other, as they move forward.
GENERATION.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents all the people born and living at about the same time.

MOVEDOWN.Orientation: Palms face each other or down.
MOVEDOWN.Movement: Both hands move down simultaneously in a deliberate motion.
MOVEDOWN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents changing position to a lower level.

POLE.Movement: The non-dominant hand is held stationary, and the dominant hand moves straight up from it, outlining a cylinder.
POLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a long, slender, rounded piece of wood or metal.

TEARRIP1.Location: In front of the body, with knuckles near each other.
TEARRIP1.Movement: The hands move apart with a forceful twisting motion from the wrists.
TEARRIP1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Shows effort. Represents pulling or ripping something apart with force.

DIGUP.Handshape: Both hands; cupped B-Handshapes or clawed 5-handshapes.
DIGUP.Location: Low in front of the body.
DIGUP.Movement: The hands make alternating scooping motions, moving up and toward the body.
DIGUP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Shows effort. Represents breaking up and moving earth with a tool or the hands.

ROSE.Handshape: Dominant hand; R-Handshape (index and middle fingers crossed).
ROSE.Location: At the side of the nose.
ROSE.Movement: The hand moves up and across the front of the nose.
ROSE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May be accompanied by a pleasant sniffing motion. Represents a specific type of fragrant flower.

DOWNHILL.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up and is held at a downward angle.
DOWNHILL.Movement: The dominant hand moves down the length of the angled non-dominant hand.
DOWNHILL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a downward slope.

CAPTURE.Handshape: Dominant hand; cupped 5-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape.
CAPTURE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant finger points up.
CAPTURE.Movement: The dominant hand moves down quickly and closes over the top of the non-dominant index finger.
CAPTURE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused, quick expression. Represents the action of catching or taking possession of something.

ANYONE.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended to the side.
ANYONE.Movement: The hand moves from side to side in an arc.
ANYONE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Questioning expression (furrowed or raised brows). Represents any person or people.

IMPROVE.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant arm is held horizontally.
IMPROVE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side.
IMPROVE.Movement: The pinky-edge of the dominant hand makes a series of upward chopping motions along the non-dominant arm from wrist to elbow.
IMPROVE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Positive, focused expression. Represents the action of making or becoming better.

STORY1.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes (thumb and index finger touch, forming a circle).
STORY1.Movement: The hands start with fingertips interlinked and pull apart repeatedly as they move outward.
STORY1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or expressive, depending on the narrative. Represents a tale or narrative.

ADVANTAGE.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
ADVANTAGE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
ADVANTAGE.Movement: The dominant middle finger starts on the heel of the non-dominant palm and moves up and off the fingertips.
ADVANTAGE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or positive expression. Represents having a superior or favorable position.

LEAVEALONE.Movement: The hands push forward in a sharp, definite motion, moving from near the body to further away.
LEAVEALONE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Firm or annoyed expression. Represents the command to stop bothering someone or something.

TURN.Handshape: Dominant hand; L-Handshape with the index finger bent.
TURN.Location: In neutral space in front of the body.
TURN.Movement: The hand twists at the wrist.
TURN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of moving in a circular direction.

CORNER.Handshape: Both hands; B-Handshapes (flat hands), held vertically.
CORNER.Movement: The hands start apart and move to meet at the fingertips, forming a right angle.
CORNER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a place or angle where two sides or edges meet.

LEND.Handshape: Both hands; K-Handshapes (index and middle fingers point up, thumb on middle finger), stacked one on top of the other.
LEND.Orientation: Palms face to the sides, fingertips point forward.
LEND.Movement: The hands start near the body and move forward together in a straight line.
LEND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents granting the use of something on the understanding it will be returned.

CHEW1.Location: At the side of the mouth.
CHEW1.Movement: The hand moves in a small circle as the jaw moves.
CHEW1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Jaw moves in a grinding or chewing motion. Represents biting and working food in the mouth.

TOSS.Movement: The hand moves up and forward in a short arc, as if throwing something underhand.
TOSS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents throwing something lightly or carelessly.

WIDE.Movement: The hands start close together and move apart horizontally.
WIDE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): 'cha' mouth morpheme (puffed cheeks). Represents having a great or more than average width.

THEORY.Handshape: Dominant hand; T-Handshape (thumb tucked between index and middle fingers).
THEORY.Location: At the side of the forehead.
THEORY.Movement: The hand moves in a small, continuous circle near the forehead.
THEORY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Thoughtful expression, furrowed brow. Represents a system of ideas intended to explain something.

FIRED.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; S-Handshape (a fist).
FIRED.Orientation: Dominant palm faces up. Non-dominant palm faces down.
FIRED.Movement: The dominant hand starts under the non-dominant fist and moves up and forward sharply, brushing past it.
FIRED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sharp, forceful motion and expression. Represents being dismissed from a job.

CARDS.Handshape: Both hands; modified X-handshapes (as if holding a deck of cards).
CARDS.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
CARDS.Movement: The dominant hand makes several short forward motions from the non-dominant hand, as if dealing.
CARDS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents playing cards.

SLICE1.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
SLICE1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SLICE1.Movement: The pinky-edge of the dominant hand makes a downward cutting motion across the non-dominant palm.
SLICE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a thin piece of food cut from a larger portion.

HATCH2.Handshape: Both hands; start as bent 5-Handshapes (claws) with fingertips interlocked.
HATCH2.Orientation: The top hand's palm is down; the bottom hand's palm is up.
HATCH2.Movement: The top hand lifts up and opens while the bottom hand moves down and opens, breaking the interlock.
HATCH2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an egg cracking open.

ENVELOPE2.Handshape: Index fingers and thumbs outline a rectangle.
ENVELOPE2.Orientation: Palms face forward or each other.
ENVELOPE2.Movement: The hands trace the shape of a rectangle in the air.
ENVELOPE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a flat paper container for mailing.

GLASS1.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
GLASS1.Movement: The thumbnail of the hooked index finger taps the front teeth.
GLASS1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Mouth is slightly open. Represents a hard, brittle substance or a drinking container made from it.

STACK1.Movement: The hands move up in an alternating pattern, as if placing items in a pile.
STACK1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents arranging a number of things in a neat pile.

CRACKER2.Handshape: Dominant hand; 5 handshape (Open palm). Non-dominant arm is held across the body.
CRACKER2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward toward the non-dominant arm.
CRACKER2.Location: The dominant fist is positioned at the elbow of the non-dominant arm.
CRACKER2.Movement: The dominant fist taps twice on the non-dominant elbow.
CRACKER2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Conceptually represents a hard, dry biscuit.

JELLY.Handshape: Dominant hand; I-Handshape (pinky extended). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
JELLY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces up.
JELLY.Movement: The dominant pinky scrapes across the non-dominant palm, from heel to fingertips.
JELLY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a sweet food with a soft, semi-solid consistency.

BENEFIT.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch).
BENEFIT.Movement: The hand starts at the chest and moves forward and down in an arc.
BENEFIT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Positive expression. Represents an advantage or profit gained from something.

EYES.Movement: The hands point to each eye respectively without touching.
EYES.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the organs of sight.

FRUIT.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch).
FRUIT.Location: At the side of the mouth on the cheek.
FRUIT.Movement: The hand twists back and forth from the wrist.
FRUIT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the sweet, fleshy product of a tree or other plant.

DROP.Handshape: Both hands; starts as an S-Handshape and opens to a 5-Handshape.
DROP.Movement: The hands start as a fist and move down a short distance while opening quickly.
DROP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of letting or making something fall vertically.

CANOE.Location: At the sides of the body.
CANOE.Movement: The hands move in alternating, circular paddling motions from front to back.
CANOE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body sways with the movement. Represents a narrow, keelless boat propelled by a paddle.

TEETH.Movement: The tip of the bent index finger moves horizontally across the front of the teeth.
TEETH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Mouth is open in a slight smile to expose the teeth. Represents the hard, bony enamel-coated structures in the jaw.

THERMOMETER.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side, finger pointing up.
THERMOMETER.Movement: The dominant index finger starts at the base of the stationary non-dominant index finger and slides up.
THERMOMETER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes may follow the upward movement. Represents an instrument for measuring temperature.

FORFEIT.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch).
FORFEIT.Movement: The hand makes a sharp, outward throwing motion from the wrist.
FORFEIT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Firm, decisive expression. Represents losing or giving up something as a penalty.

CRAZY.Location: At the side of the head, near the temple.
CRAZY.Movement: The hand moves in a frantic circle near the temple, without touching.
CRAZY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Wild, unfocused facial expression. Represents being mentally deranged or out of control.

LESSON.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
LESSON.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
LESSON.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the fingertips of the non-dominant palm and makes a chopping motion toward the wrist.
LESSON.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a period of time in which a person is taught about a subject.

NUT1.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape (a fist with thumb alongside).
NUT1.Movement: The thumb starts behind the top teeth and flicks forward.
NUT1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Teeth are bared slightly. Represents a fruit consisting of a hard shell and an edible kernel.

FEDUP.Movement: The hand moves straight up, stopping abruptly with the back of the hand touching the chin.
FEDUP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Frustrated expression, head may tilt back sharply. Represents being annoyed, unhappy, or bored.

BYE.Location: In neutral space at the side.
BYE.Movement: The hand pivots at the wrist, waving the fingers up and down.
BYE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A smiling or neutral expression. Represents a conventional parting remark.

GERMANY.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingers point up.
GERMANY.Location: In front of the chest, with the dominant hand crossing over the non-dominant at the wrists.
GERMANY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific country in Europe.

BUDGET.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
BUDGET.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
BUDGET.Movement: The dominant hand makes a chopping motion from top to bottom into the opening of the non-dominant hand.
BUDGET.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, thoughtful expression. Represents an estimate of income and expenditure.

FREEDOM.Orientation: Palms start inward and turn forward.
FREEDOM.Movement: The hands start crossed as fists and move apart horizontally while opening, breaking a bond.
FREEDOM.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A powerful, liberating facial expression. Represents the power or right to act, speak, or think as one wants.

CUT.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
CUT.Movement: The two extended fingers open and close repeatedly, as if they were scissor blades.
CUT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of using a sharp implement to divide something.

PROOF.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
PROOF.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
PROOF.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the mouth, then moves down to land firmly on the non-dominant palm.
PROOF.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A firm, definite facial expression. Represents evidence or argument establishing a fact as true.

SHARE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up, with the hand held vertically.
SHARE.Movement: The pinky-edge of the dominant hand moves back and forth in the space between the thumb and index finger of the non-dominant hand.
SHARE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents having a portion of something with others.

COST.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape held vertically.
COST.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
COST.Movement: The dominant hooked finger strikes down on the non-dominant palm.
COST.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the amount that has to be paid or spent to obtain something.

LOUSY.Handshape: Dominant hand; '3' Handshape (thumb, index, and middle fingers extended).
LOUSY.Location: Starts with the thumb on the tip of the nose.
LOUSY.Movement: The hand moves down and away from the face forcefully.
LOUSY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Disgusted facial expression. Represents being of very poor or bad quality.

FUNNY.Handshape: Dominant hand; H-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
FUNNY.Movement: The fingertips brush down and off the tip of the nose twice.
FUNNY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A smiling or laughing expression. Represents causing laughter or amusement.

SWIM1.Movement: The hands move forward and out in alternating, circular motions.
SWIM1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents propelling the body through water by using the limbs.

DISCUSS.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
DISCUSS.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
DISCUSS.Movement: The dominant index finger repeatedly taps the non-dominant palm in different spots.
DISCUSS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Interactive expression, eye contact. Represents talking about something with others.

ROBOT.Handshape: Both hands; bent V-Handshapes or clawed 5-handshapes.
ROBOT.Movement: The hands move forward in a stiff, alternating, mechanical motion.
ROBOT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Stiff body posture, rigid facial expression. Represents a machine that replicates human movements.

GRAY.Orientation: Palms face inward, toward the body.
GRAY.Movement: The hands move back and forth, passing through the fingers of the opposite hand with each pass.
GRAY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a color intermediate between black and white.

SNAP.Handshape: Dominant hand; transitions from a flat hand to closing the middle finger against the thumb.
SNAP.Orientation: Palm faces to the side or up.
SNAP.Movement: The middle finger moves down to strike the thumb and create a sharp sound.
SNAP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents making a sharp cracking sound with the fingers.

ISOLATED.Handshape: Dominant hand; index shape (index finger extended).
ISOLATED.Movement: The hand circles a central point.
ISOLATED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Solitary, lonely expression. Represents being far away from others; alone.

PEAS2.Orientation: Non-dominant hand is held horizontally, palm inward. Dominant hand has palm facing down.
PEAS2.Movement: The dominant index finger makes a series of tapping motions along the length of the non-dominant index finger.
PEAS2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents small, spherical green seeds eaten as a vegetable.

BEAVER.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-hand. Non-dominant hand; B-hand held horizontally.
BEAVER.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant arm is across the body.
BEAVER.Movement: The dominant hand rests on the non-dominant elbow and flaps up and down like a tail.
BEAVER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May include showing large teeth. Represents a large semiaquatic rodent.

FREEZE.Handshape: Both hands; start as open 5-Handshapes and close to clawed 5-handshapes.
FREEZE.Movement: The hands start forward and pull back toward the body while the fingers clench and tense up.
FREEZE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body becomes rigid, may shiver. Represents becoming rigid or motionless.

WILL.Location: Starts at the side of the head, near the jawline.
WILL.Movement: The hand moves forward in a straight, deliberate line.
WILL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Determined expression. Represents expressing the future tense or a firm intention.

MEMBER.Movement: The hand taps the non-dominant side of the chest, then moves across to tap the dominant side.
MEMBER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a person belonging to a group or organization.

BEST.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as a B-Handshape and may transition to an A-Handshape with thumb up.
BEST.Movement: The hand starts at the mouth and moves up and away to the side.
BEST.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Positive, affirmative expression. Represents something of the most excellent or desirable quality.

LIKE.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an open 5-Handshape and closes with the middle finger and thumb touching.
LIKE.Movement: The hand starts on the chest and moves forward slightly while the fingers close.
LIKE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleasant, positive facial expression. Represents finding something pleasant or enjoyable.

PENIS.Handshape: Dominant hand; P-Handshape (index and middle fingers point down, thumb tip on middle finger).
PENIS.Movement: The tip of the middle finger taps the side of the nose.
PENIS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the male genital organ.

DRY.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an Index-Handshape and closes to an X-Handshape.
DRY.Movement: The hand starts at one side of the chin and moves horizontally to the other side while changing handshape.
DRY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents being free from moisture or liquid.

DICTIONARY.Handshape: Dominant hand; D-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
DICTIONARY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
DICTIONARY.Movement: The dominant hand moves in a circular motion over the non-dominant palm.
DICTIONARY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a book or electronic resource listing words of a language.

GUILLOTINE2.Location: At the back of the neck.
GUILLOTINE2.Movement: The hand makes a short, sharp downward chopping motion toward the back of the neck.
GUILLOTINE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Head may jerk forward slightly. Represents a device for beheading or being fired.

THINKCONNECT.Handshape: First part: Dominant Index-Handshape. Second part: Both F-Handshapes.
THINKCONNECT.Orientation: Index-hand palm inward. F-Hand palms face each other.
THINKCONNECT.Location: At the forehead, then in front of the body.
THINKCONNECT.Movement: The index finger taps the forehead, then the F-hands link their fingers together.
THINKCONNECT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Thoughtful expression. Represents understanding the relationship between ideas.

THEY1.Orientation: Palm faces down or to the side.
THEY1.Location: In neutral space on one side of the body.
THEY1.Movement: The hand points to one side and then sweeps horizontally to the other side.
THEY1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a group of people previously mentioned.

REDFACED.Handshape: First part: Index-hand. Second part: C-hand.
REDFACED.Location: At the mouth, then around the face.
REDFACED.Movement: The index finger moves down the lips, then the C-hand circles the face.
REDFACED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Embarrassed facial expression. Represents being embarrassed or ashamed.

SCARMEMORY.Handshape: First part: X-hand. Second part: S-hand.
SCARMEMORY.Location: First on the body, then at the forehead.
SCARMEMORY.Movement: The X-hand draws a line on the skin, then the S-hand moves from the forehead outward, opening slightly.
SCARMEMORY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pained or thoughtful expression. Represents a lasting and painful memory of an event.

LIMITED.Orientation: Palms face each other, fingertips point forward.
LIMITED.Location: In front of the body, starting wide apart.
LIMITED.Movement: Both hands move toward each other and stop abruptly to show a boundary.
LIMITED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pursed lips. Represents being restricted in size, amount, or extent.

SHAKE2.Orientation: Palms face each other or down.
SHAKE2.Movement: The hands shake back and forth rapidly from the wrists.
SHAKE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents moving an object up and down or from side to side with forceful, jerky movements.

THOUGHTDISAPPEAR.Handshape: First part: Index-Handshape. Second part: open 5-Handshape closing to a flat O-handshape.
THOUGHTDISAPPEAR.Location: First at the forehead, then in front of the body.
THOUGHTDISAPPEAR.Movement: The index finger taps the forehead, then the open 5-hand moves down while closing.
THOUGHTDISAPPEAR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): 'poof' mouth morpheme. Represents an idea or memory being completely forgotten.

CHOKE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pained, gasping facial expression; body may be tense. Represents having severe difficulty in breathing.

GREENBEANS.Handshape: First part: 'G' handshape. Second part: Both Index-Handshapes.
GREENBEANS.Orientation: 'G' hand palm faces side. Index-finger palms face each other.
GREENBEANS.Movement: The 'G' hand shakes, then the dominant index finger moves along the side of the non-dominant index finger.
GREENBEANS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a long narrow green vegetable eaten as food.

TOGETHER.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
TOGETHER.Orientation: Palms face each other, knuckles point forward.
TOGETHER.Movement: The hands start apart and move together until the knuckles touch, often moving in a circle.
TOGETHER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents being with or in proximity to another person or group.

INSPIRE.Handshape: Both hands; start as flat O-Handshapes and open to 5-handshapes.
INSPIRE.Orientation: Palms start facing up and inward.
INSPIRE.Movement: The hands start at the stomach and move up the chest while opening up.
INSPIRE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): An inspired, uplifting expression. Represents filling someone with the urge or ability to do something creative.

FOLLOW2.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
FOLLOW2.Movement: The dominant hand starts behind the non-dominant hand, and both move forward together.
FOLLOW2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents moving or traveling behind someone or something.

RULER.Handshape: Both hands; Y-Handshapes (thumb and pinky extended).
RULER.Movement: The hands start with thumbs touching, and the dominant hand moves away to the side to indicate a length.
RULER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a straight strip of material used for measuring.

GOATEE.Movement: The hand traces the outline of a small pointed beard on the chin.
GOATEE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a style of facial hair on a man's chin.

SPREAD1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SPREAD1.Movement: The dominant hand moves back and forth over the non-dominant palm, as if spreading a substance like butter.
SPREAD1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents opening something out over a larger area.

WISE.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
WISE.Orientation: Palm faces to the side, fingertip points up.
WISE.Movement: The hand moves up and down slightly from the wrist while held at the forehead.
WISE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Thoughtful, knowledgeable expression. Represents having or showing experience and good judgment.

EVIDENCE.Handshape: Dominant hand; E-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
EVIDENCE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
EVIDENCE.Movement: The dominant hand starts near the eye, then moves down to land firmly on the non-dominant palm.
EVIDENCE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A firm, definite facial expression. Represents the available body of facts indicating a belief is true.

NOOSE.Handshape: Dominant hand; C-Handshape that closes to a fist.
NOOSE.Movement: The hand moves around the neck and then pulls up sharply.
NOOSE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Grim expression. Represents a loop with a running knot used for hanging.

POSTPONE.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes (thumb and index finger touch).
POSTPONE.Orientation: Palms face each other, fingertips point forward.
POSTPONE.Movement: The hands start together, then the dominant hand moves forward in one or more small arcs.
POSTPONE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents arranging for something to take place at a later time.

JUICE2.Location: At the corner of the mouth.
JUICE2.Movement: The hand twists back and forth at the corner of the mouth.
JUICE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the liquid obtained from fruit or vegetables.

JOIN.Handshape: Dominant hand; U-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
JOIN.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
JOIN.Movement: The dominant hand moves into the opening of the non-dominant hand.
JOIN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents becoming a member of or associated with a group.

REFUSE.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended.
REFUSE.Orientation: Palm faces to the side, thumb points up.
REFUSE.Location: In front of the dominant shoulder.
REFUSE.Movement: The hand moves back over the shoulder in a sharp, dismissive motion.
REFUSE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A strong negative headshake and a firm expression. Represents indicating an unwillingness to do something.

VOCABULARY.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape.
VOCABULARY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
VOCABULARY.Movement: The dominant hand taps down the length of the non-dominant index finger, from base to tip.
VOCABULARY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the body of words used in a particular language.

TENDENCY.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward.
TENDENCY.Location: At the center of the chest.
TENDENCY.Movement: The hand starts with the middle finger touching the chest and moves forward in a straight line.
TENDENCY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an inclination toward a particular characteristic or behavior.

BANDAID1.Handshape: Both hands; H-Handshapes (index and middle fingers extended).
BANDAID1.Orientation: Palms face inward toward the non-dominant arm.
BANDAID1.Location: On the non-dominant forearm or hand.
BANDAID1.Movement: The dominant hand moves in a wrapping motion around the non-dominant arm.
BANDAID1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a strip of material for binding a wound.

WEIRD.Movement: The hand starts on one side of the face and moves horizontally to the other side with a slight wavy motion.
WEIRD.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A strange or unusual facial expression. Represents something that is strange or peculiar.

CHEERLEADER1.Movement: The hands shake vigorously, as if holding and shaking pompoms.
CHEERLEADER1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Energetic, enthusiastic expression. Represents a person who leads cheers at a sports event.

LESBIAN.Handshape: Dominant hand; L-Handshape (thumb and index finger extended).
LESBIAN.Movement: The thumb of the L-handshape touches the center of the chin.
LESBIAN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a homosexual woman.

CAUGHT.Handshape: Dominant hand; C-Handshape that closes to an S-handshape. Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape.
CAUGHT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant finger points up.
CAUGHT.Movement: The dominant hand moves down and closes quickly around the non-dominant index finger.
CAUGHT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sharp, sudden expression. Represents the action of intercepting and holding something.

BRICK.Handshape: Both hands; L-Handshapes (thumb and index finger extended).
BRICK.Movement: The hands move to outline a small rectangular shape.
BRICK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a small rectangular block used in building.

KINDERGARTEN.Handshape: Dominant hand; K-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
KINDERGARTEN.Orientation: Dominant palm faces up. Non-dominant palm faces down.
KINDERGARTEN.Movement: The dominant hand is placed under the non-dominant hand and shakes back and forth.
KINDERGARTEN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or pleasant expression. Represents a school or class that prepares children for first grade.

PHILADELPHIA.Location: In neutral space on the dominant side of the body.
PHILADELPHIA.Movement: The hand moves to the right, and then diagonally down to the left, tracing a '7' shape.
PHILADELPHIA.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific city in the United States.

COMEHERE.Location: Starts extended away from the body.
COMEHERE.Movement: The hand moves toward the body while the index finger repeatedly bends in and straightens.
COMEHERE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or commanding expression. Represents a command to move toward the speaker.

TWOOFUS.Handshape: Dominant hand; K-Handshape (index and middle fingers point up, thumb on middle finger).
TWOOFUS.Movement: The hand pivots at the wrist, moving back and forth between the signer and another point representing a person.
TWOOFUS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a group of two people including the signer.

SENIORCITIZEN.Movement: The fist, taps the chin, then opens slightly to a 'C' shape.
SENIORCITIZEN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an older person, especially one who is retired.

CRANKY.Movement: The hand twists back and forth at the wrist.
CRANKY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Cranky, irritable facial expression. Represents being bad-tempered or irritable.

AFTERNOON.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant arm is held horizontally.
AFTERNOON.Movement: The dominant hand is hinged at the elbow on the non-dominant hand and moves down in an arc.
AFTERNOON.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the time from noon or lunchtime to evening.

PASS.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
PASS.Movement: The dominant hand starts behind the non-dominant hand and moves forward past it in an arc.
PASS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents moving past or beyond something.

CONFUSED1.Orientation: One palm faces inward, one palm faces outward.
CONFUSED1.Movement: The hands move in large, alternating circles.
CONFUSED1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Confused facial expression, furrowed brow. Represents being unable to think clearly.

HOWL.Movement: The hand moves up and forward from the mouth in an arc.
HOWL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Head tilts back. Represents a long, doleful cry, like that of a wolf.

DRAG1.Movement: The hand starts forward and moves back toward the body with tension, as if pulling a heavy object.
DRAG1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Shows effort in face and body. Represents pulling something along forcefully or with difficulty.

PARALLEL.Orientation: Palms face down, fingertips point forward.
PARALLEL.Movement: The hands move forward simultaneously while staying an equal distance apart.
PARALLEL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents lines or surfaces that are side by side and have the same distance continuously between them.

ROOMMATE.Handshape: Both hands; bent X-Handshapes (index fingers are hooked).
ROOMMATE.Movement: The hands move toward each other and the hooked fingers interlock, then shake slightly.
ROOMMATE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a person occupying the same room as another.

STRUGGLE.Movement: The hands move back and forth in a forceful, alternating motion, as if pulling against each other.
STRUGGLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Strained facial expression, body shows tension. Represents making forceful efforts to get free of restraint.

BOSTON.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand) held horizontally.
BOSTON.Location: In neutral space at the dominant side of the body.
BOSTON.Movement: The hand moves up and down twice in a short motion from the wrist.
BOSTON.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific city in the United States.
