SUPERVISE.Handshape: Both hands; K-Handshapes (index and middle fingers point up, thumb on middle finger).
SUPERVISE.Movement: The non-dominant hand is held stationary while the dominant hand moves in a horizontal circle above it.
SUPERVISE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Watchful, alert expression. Represents observing and directing a task or activity.

DESIGN.Handshape: Dominant hand; D-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
DESIGN.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
DESIGN.Movement: The dominant hand moves in a wavy, S-shaped path down the non-dominant palm.
DESIGN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Artistic, thoughtful expression. Represents a plan or drawing produced to show the look and function of something.

PUNCHFACE.Location: At the side of the face.
PUNCHFACE.Movement: The fist moves forward a short, sharp distance toward the face, often with a twist.
PUNCHFACE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Angry expression. Represents the action of striking the face with a fist.

SANDWICH2.Orientation: Palms face inward toward each other.
SANDWICH2.Movement: The hands start apart and move together, with one hand sliding inside the other as they reach the mouth.
SANDWICH2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a food item with filling between two pieces of bread.

AGAIN.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent B-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
AGAIN.Orientation: Dominant palm faces up. Non-dominant palm faces up.
AGAIN.Movement: The dominant hand starts to the side and moves in an arc to land with fingertips in the center of the non-dominant palm.
AGAIN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents another time; once more.

TASTE.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward.
TASTE.Movement: The tip of the middle finger taps the chin or lower lip once or twice.
TASTE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the sensation of flavor perceived in the mouth.

POSITIVE.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape.
POSITIVE.Orientation: Palms face forward or to the side.
POSITIVE.Movement: The dominant index finger moves down and then across the non-dominant index finger, forming a plus sign.
POSITIVE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Affirmative expression. Represents consisting in or characterized by the presence rather than the absence of features.

FORMER.Orientation: Palm faces inward, toward the cheek.
FORMER.Movement: The hand moves backward over the shoulder.
FORMER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents having previously filled a particular role or been a particular thing.

STETHOSCOPE3.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch).
STETHOSCOPE3.Movement: The hand moves from the ear to a spot on the chest, then to another spot on the chest.
STETHOSCOPE3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Analytical expression. Represents a medical instrument for listening to internal sounds of the body.

CONFLICT.Movement: The hands start apart and then cross at the wrists, moving back and forth in forceful opposition.
CONFLICT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Conflicted, angry facial expression. Represents a serious disagreement or argument.

REMIND.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent B-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; A-handshape with thumb extended.
REMIND.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
REMIND.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the forehead and moves down to tap the thumbnail of the non-dominant hand.
REMIND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents causing someone to remember someone or something.

JACKET2.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes with thumbs extended up.
JACKET2.Movement: The hands start at the shoulders and move down the chest, with the thumbs brushing the body.
JACKET2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an outer garment extending to the waist or hips.

HALFHOUR.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand) held vertically.
HALFHOUR.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
HALFHOUR.Movement: The dominant hand starts with the pinky-edge at the top of the non-dominant palm and moves halfway down.
HALFHOUR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a period of thirty minutes.

FACULTY.Movement: The hand taps one side of the chest, then moves across to tap the other side.
FACULTY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the teaching staff of a university or college.

TRIPLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; 3-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
TRIPLE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
TRIPLE.Movement: The pinky-edge of the dominant hand starts at the heel of the non-dominant palm and moves forward to the fingertips.
TRIPLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents consisting of three parts, elements, or people.

SWEET.Movement: The fingertips start at the chin and brush down twice, with the fingers bending slightly.
SWEET.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleasant, gentle expression. Represents having the pleasant taste characteristic of sugar.

SELL.Orientation: Palms face each other, fingertips point down and away.
SELL.Movement: The hands start near the body and pivot forward and back from the wrists in a repeated motion.
SELL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents giving or handing over something in exchange for money.

FOCUS.Location: Starts at the sides of the head, near the eyes.
FOCUS.Movement: Both hands move forward from the eyes to a single point in front of the body.
FOCUS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Intense, focused facial expression. Represents the center of interest or activity.

RHINO1.Handshape: Dominant hand; Y-Handshape (thumb and pinky extended).
RHINO1.Movement: The hand starts with the pinky at the nose and moves forward and up in an arc.
RHINO1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a large mammal with one or two horns on the nose.

BLEED.Handshape: Dominant hand; open 5-Handshape with fingers wiggling. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
BLEED.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces up.
BLEED.Movement: The dominant hand moves down the palm and arm of the non-dominant hand while the fingers wiggle.
BLEED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or pained expression. Represents the instance of losing blood from the body.

POOR.Handshape: Dominant hand; cupped 5-Handshape. Non-dominant arm is bent across the body.
POOR.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the elbow and pulls down and off, closing the fingers.
POOR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sad, downtrodden expression. Represents lacking sufficient money to live comfortably.

GRANDMOTHER.Movement: The hand starts at the chin and moves forward in two small arcs.
GRANDMOTHER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleasant, gentle expression. Represents the mother of one's father or mother.

BRA2.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point toward each other.
BRA2.Movement: The hands start at the center of the chest and move out to the sides, outlining the shape of the garment.
BRA2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an undergarment worn by women to support the breasts.

VILLAGE.Orientation: Palms face down, angled to form a peak.
VILLAGE.Movement: The hands make several small 'roof' shapes in a horizontal line from one side to the other.
VILLAGE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a group of houses in a rural area.

FURNITURE.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch).
FURNITURE.Orientation: Palm faces forward or to the side.
FURNITURE.Movement: The hand shakes back and forth from the wrist with a small, trembling motion.
FURNITURE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents movable articles used to make a room suitable for living.

WITH.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
WITH.Movement: The hands start apart and move together until the knuckles touch.
WITH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents being accompanied by or in the same place as another.

TOW1.Handshape: Both hands; S-Handshapes (fists) with index fingers slightly hooked.
TOW1.Movement: The hands hook together (one fist behind the other) and move forward with tension, as if pulling.
TOW1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Shows effort. Represents pulling a vehicle or boat along behind another.

CANADA.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape (fist with thumb alongside).
CANADA.Location: On the upper dominant side of the chest.
CANADA.Movement: The hand grasps the shirt or chest and taps it twice.
CANADA.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific country in North America.

SLICE4.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
SLICE4.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SLICE4.Movement: The pinky-edge of the dominant hand makes a downward cutting motion across the non-dominant palm.
SLICE4.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a thin piece of food cut from a larger portion.

BLOWCANDLE1.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; open 5-handshape.
BLOWCANDLE1.Orientation: Dominant finger points up. Non-dominant palm faces up.
BLOWCANDLE1.Movement: The dominant index finger is held up while the signer blows, then the fingers of the non-dominant hand close.
BLOWCANDLE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Cheeks are puffed to blow air. Represents extinguishing a candle flame with one's breath.

THROW1.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an S-Handshape and opens to a loose 5-handshape.
THROW1.Movement: The hand moves forward from the shoulder while opening, as if propelling a ball.
THROW1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents propelling something through the air with the arm.

CHEW2MOUTH.Location: At the side of the mouth.
CHEW2MOUTH.Movement: The hand moves in a small circle as the jaw moves.
CHEW2MOUTH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Jaw moves in a grinding or chewing motion. Represents biting and working food in the mouth.

JACKET3.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes with thumbs extended up.
JACKET3.Movement: The hands start at the shoulders and move down the chest, with the thumbs brushing the body.
JACKET3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an outer garment extending to the waist or hips.

FINALLY.Orientation: Palms face back toward the signer.
FINALLY.Location: At the sides of the head, near the eyes.
FINALLY.Movement: The hands move up and forward in arcs, ending with palms facing inward.
FINALLY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A relieved or triumphant expression. Represents that which has happened after a long time.

ARRIVE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
ARRIVE.Movement: The non-dominant hand is held stationary. The dominant hand starts away from the body and moves to land on the non-dominant palm.
ARRIVE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of reaching a place at the end of a journey.

CAUSE.Handshape: Both hands; start as S-Handshapes and the dominant hand opens to a 5-handshape.
CAUSE.Movement: The dominant hand starts near the stationary non-dominant hand and moves forward and up while opening.
CAUSE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a person or thing that gives rise to an action or condition.

TRIM2.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
TRIM2.Orientation: Palm faces to the side or down.
TRIM2.Location: In front of the body, or near the object being cut.
TRIM2.Movement: The two extended fingers open and close repeatedly, as if they were scissor blades.
TRIM2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents cutting away irregular or unwanted parts.

PET2.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; S-Handshape (a fist).
PET2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces down.
PET2.Movement: The dominant hand gently and repeatedly strokes the back of the non-dominant fist.
PET2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Affectionate expression. Represents stroking or caressing an animal fondly.

GUN1.Location: In neutral space, held out from the body.
GUN1.Movement: The index finger bends down as the thumb moves up, as if a hammer on a firearm.
GUN1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused, intense expression. Represents a weapon that propels bullets.

FRENCH.Orientation: Palm starts facing to the side and twists to face inward.
FRENCH.Location: In neutral space in front of the shoulder.
FRENCH.Movement: The hand twists at the wrist from outward to inward.
FRENCH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the language or people of a specific country in Europe.

CALENDAR2.Handshape: Dominant hand; 4-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
CALENDAR2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces forward.
CALENDAR2.Movement: The dominant hand moves down and across the non-dominant palm, as if outlining a grid.
CALENDAR2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a chart showing days, weeks, and months.

MAGIC.Handshape: Both hands; start as S-Handshapes and open to clawed 5-Handshapes.
MAGIC.Movement: The hands start as fists and open up with a flourish as they move forward.
MAGIC.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Mystical or amazed expression. Represents the power of influencing events by using supernatural forces.

LINE.Movement: The hands start with pinkies touching and move apart horizontally in a straight path.
LINE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a long, narrow mark or band.

ENJOY.Movement: The hands rub the chest in simultaneous or alternating circles.
ENJOY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A pleasant, happy facial expression. Represents taking delight or pleasure in something.

WANT2.Movement: The hands start forward and pull back toward the body while the fingers close slightly.
WANT2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Desirous expression. Represents having a desire to possess or do something.

KNITTING2.Orientation: Palms face each other, fingertips point down and away.
KNITTING2.Movement: The hands move up and down in a small, quick, alternating motion, as if using needles.
KNITTING2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents the craft of making fabric from yarn.

DART.Handshape: Dominant hand; index finger and thumb pinch together.
DART.Movement: The hand starts back near the eye and moves forward with a flick of the wrist, releasing the pinch.
DART.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sighting with one eye closed. Represents throwing a small pointed missile.

SURE.Orientation: Palm faces to the side, fingertip points up.
SURE.Movement: The hand starts at the chin and moves forward in a straight, definite arc.
SURE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A firm, confident head nod. Represents being completely confident that one is right.

CANDLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; open 5-Handshape with wiggling fingers. Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape.
CANDLE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces forward. Non-dominant finger points up.
CANDLE.Movement: The dominant hand is held above the tip of the non-dominant index finger, and its fingers wiggle.
CANDLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a cylinder of wax with a wick that is lit to produce light.

SWIM2.Movement: The hands move forward and out in alternating, circular breaststroke motions.
SWIM2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents propelling the body through water by using the limbs.

SECRET.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended.
SECRET.Movement: The thumbnail taps the lips twice.
SECRET.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Secretive expression, may include a 'shhh' gesture. Represents something kept from knowledge or view.

HOUSE.Handshape: Both hands; B-Handshapes (a flat hand with all four fingers extended and held together).
HOUSE.Orientation: Palms face inward and are angled down to form a peak; fingertips of both hands may touch.
HOUSE.Location: Begins in the signing space above the head.
HOUSE.Movement: The hands trace the shape of a gabled roof downwards, then move straight down vertically.
HOUSE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral facial expression. Conceptually represents a dwelling, home, or structure.

DOLL.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
DOLL.Movement: The hand brushes down the bridge of the nose twice.
DOLL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a small model of a human figure, typically used as a child's toy.

HAIRCUT.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
HAIRCUT.Movement: The hand moves around the head while opening and closing the two extended fingers.
HAIRCUT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of cutting hair.

JUGGLE.Movement: The hands move up and down in an alternating motion, as if tossing and catching multiple objects.
JUGGLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes follow the movement of imaginary objects. Represents continuously tossing and catching objects.

HOTCOMPETITION.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes with thumbs extended up.
HOTCOMPETITION.Movement: The hands move forward and back rapidly and forcefully in opposition.
HOTCOMPETITION.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Intense, competitive facial expression. Represents a very strong rivalry.

THEY2.Orientation: Palm faces down or to the side.
THEY2.Location: In neutral space on one side of the body.
THEY2.Movement: The hand points to one side and then sweeps horizontally to the other side.
THEY2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a group of people previously mentioned.

EARN.Handshape: Dominant hand; C-Handshape that closes. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
EARN.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
EARN.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the fingertips of the non-dominant palm, sweeps back to the heel, and closes into a fist.
EARN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents obtaining money in return for labor or services.

BICYCLE.Movement: The hands move in alternating vertical circles, as if pedaling.
BICYCLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a two-wheeled vehicle propelled by pedals.

THIRSTY.Orientation: Palm faces inward, fingertip points toward the neck.
THIRSTY.Location: On the centerline of the throat.
THIRSTY.Movement: The index finger moves straight down the length of the neck.
THIRSTY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Mouth may be dry, tongue may lick lips. Represents a feeling of needing or wanting to drink.

PATIENT3.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape (a fist with the thumb extended up the side).
PATIENT3.Orientation: The thumb-side of the hand faces the chin, palm faces to the side.
PATIENT3.Location: The tip of the thumb starts at the upper lip.
PATIENT3.Movement: The thumb moves straight down over the lips and chin.
PATIENT3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Calm, still expression, head may nod slightly. Represents endurance or tolerance.

PAINT.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
PAINT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
PAINT.Movement: The dominant hand moves back and forth across the non-dominant palm, as if using a paintbrush.
PAINT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a colored substance which is spread over a surface.

FEBRUARY.Handshape: Dominant hand; transitions through the handshapes for 'F', 'E', and 'B'.
FEBRUARY.Location: In neutral space in front of the shoulder.
FEBRUARY.Movement: The hand forms each letter in a quick, smooth sequence.
FEBRUARY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the second month of the year.

HEAR1.Movement: The fingertip taps the ear once or twice.
HEAR1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the faculty of perceiving sounds.

STAND2.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
STAND2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
STAND2.Movement: The fingertips of the dominant hand are placed and held stationary on the non-dominant palm.
STAND2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents having an upright position on one's feet.

LESS.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
LESS.Movement: The dominant hand starts high above the stationary non-dominant hand and moves down toward it, indicating a reduction.
LESS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a smaller amount of; not as much.

DICE.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an S-Handshape and opens to a loose 5-handshape.
DICE.Orientation: Palm faces to the side, then down.
DICE.Movement: The hand shakes back and forth, then moves forward and opens, as if throwing dice.
DICE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents small cubes used in games of chance.

YOUNG.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point to the sides.
YOUNG.Location: At the sides of the chest, near the shoulders.
YOUNG.Movement: The fingertips brush up the chest twice.
YOUNG.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or pleasant expression. Represents having lived for only a short time.

INTERPRETER.Handshape: First part: Both F-Handshapes. Second part: Both B-Handshapes.
INTERPRETER.Orientation: F-Hand palms face each other. B-Hand palms face each other.
INTERPRETER.Location: In front of the body, then at the sides.
INTERPRETER.Movement: The F-hands twist in opposition, then two flat hands move down the sides of the torso.
INTERPRETER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, focused expression. Represents a person who translates speech orally.

EAGLE2.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
EAGLE2.Movement: The back of the hooked finger taps the nose twice, representing a beak.
EAGLE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a large bird of prey.

PRINCE.Movement: The hand moves from the non-dominant shoulder down and across to the dominant hip, as if tracing a sash.
PRINCE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, formal expression. Represents the son of a monarch.

STUCK.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
STUCK.Orientation: Palm faces inward, fingertips point to the neck.
STUCK.Movement: The fingertips jab into the throat once firmly.
STUCK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A strained, stuck expression. Represents being fixed in a particular position or unable to move.

RAT.Handshape: Dominant hand; R-Handshape (index and middle fingers crossed).
RAT.Movement: The hand brushes back and forth across the tip of the nose.
RAT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Nose may wrinkle. Represents a rodent that resembles a large mouse.

CIRCLE.Orientation: Palm faces down or to the side.
CIRCLE.Movement: The hand moves to draw a circle in the air with the index finger.
CIRCLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a round plane figure whose boundary consists of points equidistant from a fixed point.

PEANUTBUTTER.Handshape: First part: A-hand. Second part: Dominant H-hand, non-dominant B-hand.
PEANUTBUTTER.Orientation: H-hand palm faces down. B-hand palm faces up.
PEANUTBUTTER.Location: First at the mouth, then in front of the body.
PEANUTBUTTER.Movement: The thumb of the A-hand flicks forward off the top teeth. Then, the dominant H-hand brushes across the non-dominant B-hand palm.
PEANUTBUTTER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a spread made from ground roasted peanuts.

BELT2.Handshape: Both hands; H-Handshapes (index and middle fingers extended).
BELT2.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point toward each other.
BELT2.Movement: The hands start at the sides and move to meet in the middle, as if buckling a belt.
BELT2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a strip of leather or other material worn around the waist.

ROCKET2.Handshape: Dominant hand; R-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
ROCKET2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces up. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
ROCKET2.Movement: The dominant hand starts inside the non-dominant hand and moves up quickly, as if launching.
ROCKET2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes look up. Represents a spacecraft propelled by a specific type of engine.

BEE2.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an F-Handshape and transitions to a B-Handshape.
BEE2.Location: At the side of the mouth on the cheek.
BEE2.Movement: The F-Handshape touches the cheek, then moves away while opening and brushing with the fingertips.
BEE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific type of flying insect.

SPRING.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as a flat O-handshape and opens to a 5-handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-handshape.
SPRING.Movement: The dominant hand starts inside the non-dominant C-hand and moves up while opening, repeating the motion twice.
SPRING.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleasant expression. Represents the season when plants begin to grow.

TAKEOFF1.Handshape: Dominant hand; ILY-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
TAKEOFF1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
TAKEOFF1.Movement: The dominant hand starts on the non-dominant palm and moves up and away, representing an airplane.
TAKEOFF1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes follow movement. Represents an aircraft leaving the ground.

TRUEBUSINESS.Handshape: First part: Index-finger. Second part: Dominant B-hand, non-dominant S-hand.
TRUEBUSINESS.Orientation: Index-finger palm to the side. B-hand palm forward. S-hand palm down.
TRUEBUSINESS.Location: First at mouth, then in front of body.
TRUEBUSINESS.Movement: The index finger moves straight from the lips, then the dominant B-hand pivots on the back of the non-dominant S-hand fist.
TRUEBUSINESS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Serious, firm expression. Represents a matter that is very serious or important.

WRAP.Movement: The hands move in a large, horizontal, circular motion as if gathering things together.
WRAP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents covering something by putting material around it.

PENGUIN.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point down.
PENGUIN.Location: At the sides of the body, near the hips.
PENGUIN.Movement: The hands pivot at the wrists in a waddling motion.
PENGUIN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body may waddle from side to side. Represents a large flightless seabird.

SWING2.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape held horizontally.
SWING2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
SWING2.Movement: The dominant hand 'sits' on the non-dominant finger and moves forward and back in a repeated arc.
SWING2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body may sway with the movement. Represents a seat suspended from above for play.

SOFT.Handshape: Both hands; start as clawed 5-Handshapes and close to flat O-handshapes.
SOFT.Movement: The hands start high and move down while closing, as if squeezing something soft.
SOFT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Gentle expression. Represents being easy to mold, cut, compress, or fold.

WHITE.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an open 5-Handshape and closes to a flat O-handshape.
WHITE.Movement: The hand starts on the chest and pulls away while the fingertips and thumb come together.
WHITE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the color of milk or fresh snow.

CLUELESS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Clueless, blank facial expression. Represents having no knowledge, understanding, or ability.

TWINS1.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
TWINS1.Movement: The hand touches one side of the chin with one finger, then moves to touch the other side with the other finger.
TWINS1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents two children born of the same pregnancy.

WASHFACE1.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
WASHFACE1.Movement: The hands move in alternating or simultaneous circles on the cheeks.
WASHFACE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of cleaning one's face with soap and water.

HEARTTOUCH.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward.
HEARTTOUCH.Location: At the heart area on the chest.
HEARTTOUCH.Movement: The middle finger touches the chest, then moves forward slightly in an arc.
HEARTTOUCH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A warm, touched, emotional expression. Represents being emotionally affected by something.

CAMEL.Movement: The hand moves forward in an undulating, up-and-down path, representing humps.
CAMEL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a long-necked mammal of arid country with one or two humps.

TOAGOAL.Orientation: Non-dominant finger points up, palm faces to the side. Dominant finger points forward, palm faces to the side.
TOAGOAL.Movement: The dominant index finger starts near the forehead and moves forward to touch the tip of the stationary non-dominant index finger.
TOAGOAL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Determined, focused expression. Represents an aim or desired result.

DESSERT.Handshape: Both hands; D-Handshapes (index finger extended, other fingers and thumb form a circle).
DESSERT.Movement: The hands start apart and tap together at the fingertips twice.
DESSERT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleasant expression. Represents the sweet course eaten at the end of a meal.

MUSCLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent B-Handshape. Non-dominant arm is bent with a fist.
MUSCLE.Movement: The dominant hand taps or grasps the non-dominant bicep.
MUSCLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Tense, strong expression. Represents a band of fibrous tissue that can contract.

BUTTONS.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch).
BUTTONS.Movement: The hand moves down the centerline of the body, tapping at several points.
BUTTONS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents small knobs sewn on a garment for fastening it.

GUM.Location: At the sides of the jaw.
GUM.Movement: The fingers bend up and down from the knuckles, as if chewing.
GUM.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Chewing motion with the jaw. Represents chewing gum.

RACE.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
RACE.Movement: The hands move forward and back rapidly in opposition from the wrists.
RACE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Competitive expression. Represents a competition of speed.

LIPS.Movement: The fingertip traces the outline of the lips.
LIPS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the two fleshy parts forming the edges of the opening of the mouth.

RUIN.Orientation: One palm faces up, the other faces down, with knuckles touching.
RUIN.Movement: The hands grind against each other as they move apart.
RUIN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Negative, destructive expression. Represents the physical destruction or disintegration of something.

UNICORN.Location: At the center of the forehead.
UNICORN.Movement: The hand starts at the forehead and moves up and forward in an arc.
UNICORN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or whimsical expression. Represents a mythical animal with a single spiraling horn.

SHOULD.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
SHOULD.Orientation: Palm faces down, fingertip points forward.
SHOULD.Movement: The hand moves down repeatedly from the wrist in a short, definite motion.
SHOULD.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A firm nod. Represents what is proper or reasonable; indicates obligation.

PINON.Movement: The hand moves toward the chest and twists from the wrist, as if fastening a pin.
PINON.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of fastening something with a pin.

CURIOUS.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch).
CURIOUS.Movement: The hand pinches the skin at the throat and wiggles slightly.
CURIOUS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Curious, inquisitive expression, leaning forward. Represents being eager to know or learn something.

FIX.Orientation: Palms face each other, fingertips point down.
FIX.Movement: The hands start together and move apart in a sharp, definite motion, repeating this.
FIX.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Determined expression. Represents the action of repairing or mending something.

ARGUE.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point at each other.
ARGUE.Movement: The hands move up and down in an alternating, confrontational motion.
ARGUE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Angry, argumentative facial expression. Represents giving reasons in support of an idea, often in opposition.

SEVEN.Handshape: Dominant hand; Ring finger and thumb touch, with other fingers extended.
SEVEN.Location: In neutral space in front of the shoulder.
SEVEN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the cardinal number 7.

VAGINA.Handshape: Both hands; L-Handshapes (thumb and index finger extended).
VAGINA.Location: In front of the lower abdomen.
VAGINA.Movement: The dominant hand is placed inside the non-dominant hand, with index fingers and thumbs touching.
VAGINA.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Clinical or neutral expression. Represents the muscular tube of the female genital tract.

MICROPHONE.Handshape: Dominant hand; S-Handshape (a fist), held vertically.
MICROPHONE.Movement: The hand is held stationary, as if holding the object.
MICROPHONE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an instrument for converting sound waves into electrical signals.

RIDE2.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
RIDE2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
RIDE2.Movement: The dominant hand 'sits' in the non-dominant hand, and both move forward together.
RIDE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of traveling in a vehicle.

SKUNK.Handshape: Dominant hand; K-Handshape (index and middle fingers point up, thumb on middle finger).
SKUNK.Movement: The hand starts at the forehead and moves back over the top of the head in an arc, representing a stripe.
SKUNK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May include a wrinkled nose. Represents a mammal that ejects a foul-smelling liquid.

SOUR.Movement: The fingertip touches the cheek and twists sharply.
SOUR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A soured, puckered facial expression. Represents having an acid taste like lemon.

FENCE1.Handshape: Both hands; 4-Handshapes (four fingers extended, thumb tucked in).
FENCE1.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point up.
FENCE1.Movement: The hands start with fingers interlocked and then move apart horizontally.
FENCE1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a barrier or railing, especially one made of posts and wire.

THINKEXPAND.Handshape: First part: Index-Handshape. Second part: Both cupped 5-hands.
THINKEXPAND.Orientation: Palms face each other for the second part.
THINKEXPAND.Location: First at the forehead, then in front of the head.
THINKEXPAND.Movement: The index finger taps the forehead, then the two cupped hands start together and move apart.
THINKEXPAND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Thoughtful, expanding expression. Represents broadening one's thoughts or ideas.

DREADLOCKS.Handshape: Dominant hand; R-Handshape that wiggles down.
DREADLOCKS.Location: At the side of the head.
DREADLOCKS.Movement: The hand starts at the scalp and moves down in a twisting, wiggly path.
DREADLOCKS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a hairstyle in which the hair is twisted into braids or ringlets.

PROGRAM.Handshape: Dominant hand; P-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand) held vertically.
PROGRAM.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
PROGRAM.Movement: The dominant hand moves up one side of the non-dominant palm, over the top, and down the other side.
PROGRAM.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a planned series of future events or performances.

SAXOPHONE.Handshape: Both hands; modified C-handshapes, as if holding the instrument.
SAXOPHONE.Location: In front of the mouth and chest.
SAXOPHONE.Movement: The fingers wiggle up and down as if pressing keys.
SAXOPHONE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Cheeks may be puffed. Represents a member of a family of metal wind instruments.

FINGERSCROSSED.Handshape: Dominant hand; R-Handshape (index and middle fingers crossed).
FINGERSCROSSED.Location: Held up in front of the body.
FINGERSCROSSED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Hopeful expression. Represents hoping strongly that something will happen.

STUDY.Handshape: Dominant hand; open 5-Handshape with wiggling fingers. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
STUDY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
STUDY.Movement: The dominant hand is held above the non-dominant palm, and the fingers wiggle as the dominant hand moves slightly toward the body.
STUDY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression, eyes look down at the non-dominant hand. Represents the devotion of time and attention to acquiring knowledge.

DIZZY.Location: At the side of the head, near the temple.
DIZZY.Movement: The hand moves in a continuous circle near the temple, without touching.
DIZZY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Dizzy, unfocused facial expression, body may sway slightly. Represents having a sensation of spinning around.

ENVIRONMENT.Handshape: Dominant hand; E-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape.
ENVIRONMENT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces forward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
ENVIRONMENT.Movement: The dominant hand circles around the stationary non-dominant index finger.
ENVIRONMENT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the surroundings or conditions in which something lives or operates.

BLINK.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts with index finger and thumb apart, then pinches closed.
BLINK.Movement: The index finger and thumb pinch together quickly.
BLINK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes close and open rapidly. Represents shutting and opening the eyes quickly.

CALM.Movement: The hands start near the chest and move down and out to the sides in a smooth, gentle motion.
CALM.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A calm, peaceful facial expression. Represents being free from agitation or disturbance.

KICK2.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape held vertically.
KICK2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
KICK2.Movement: The dominant hand moves forward and strikes the palm of the non-dominant hand with its pinky-edge.
KICK2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of striking with the foot.

LINGUISTICS.Handshape: Both hands; L-Handshapes (thumb and index finger extended).
LINGUISTICS.Movement: The hands start with index fingers touching and pull apart while twisting back and forth from the wrists.
LINGUISTICS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the scientific study of language.

LOAD1.Handshape: Dominant hand; clawed 5-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
LOAD1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
LOAD1.Movement: The dominant hand starts above the non-dominant hand and moves down to place something onto the palm.
LOAD1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents putting a quantity of something onto or into something else.

VIDEOGAME.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes with thumbs extended up.
VIDEOGAME.Movement: The hands move toward and away from each other while the thumbs wiggle up and down.
VIDEOGAME.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused, competitive expression. Represents a game played electronically on a screen.

BASKETBALL2.Movement: The hands move up and flick outward from the wrists, as if shooting a ball.
BASKETBALL2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents a specific team sport played with a ball and hoops.

ONCE.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
ONCE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces up.
ONCE.Movement: The dominant index finger starts away from the non-dominant palm, moves down quickly, touches the palm, and lifts straight up.
ONCE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a single occasion or time.

AGAINST.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape held vertically.
AGAINST.Orientation: Dominant palm faces forward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
AGAINST.Movement: The dominant palm pushes firmly against the non-dominant palm.
AGAINST.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Firm, resistant expression. Represents being in opposition or conflict with something.

GRIND.Orientation: One palm faces up, the other faces down.
GRIND.Movement: The dominant fist grinds in a circular motion on top of the stationary non-dominant fist.
GRIND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Shows effort. Represents reducing something to small particles by crushing it.

SEESEE.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
SEESEE.Orientation: Palm faces inward, fingertips point forward.
SEESEE.Location: Starts with fingertips near the eye.
SEESEE.Movement: The hand moves forward in a repeated bouncing motion.
SEESEE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression, head may nod. Represents looking around or observing continuously.

PLUG2.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; S-Handshape.
PLUG2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces inward.
PLUG2.Movement: The fingertips of the dominant hand move into the opening of the non-dominant fist.
PLUG2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents inserting a device with prongs into an electrical socket.

COMMITTEE.Location: On the non-dominant side of the chest.
COMMITTEE.Movement: The hand moves in a small arc and taps the chest.
COMMITTEE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a group of people appointed for a specific function.

CRY2.Handshape: Both hands; Index-Handshape (index fingers are extended from fists).
CRY2.Orientation: Palms face inward, with fingertips starting just below the eyes.
CRY2.Location: On the cheeks, just under the eyes.
CRY2.Movement: The index fingers move down the cheeks simultaneously and repeatedly in an alternating or parallel motion.
CRY2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sad facial expression, downturned mouth. Conceptually represents weeping or tears.

BRIDGE2.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape. Non-dominant arm is held horizontally.
BRIDGE2.Movement: The fingertips of the dominant hand touch the wrist and then the elbow of the non-dominant arm.
BRIDGE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a structure built to span an obstacle.

CITY2.Handshape: Both hands; B-Handshapes (flat hands), angled to form peaks.
CITY2.Movement: The hands tap together at the fingertips several times, moving slightly side to side to represent multiple buildings.
CITY2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a large town or urban area.

SPREAD2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SPREAD2.Movement: The dominant hand moves back and forth over the non-dominant palm, as if spreading a substance.
SPREAD2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents opening something out over a larger area.

STRETCH2.Movement: The hands start close together and move apart horizontally with tension, as if stretching an elastic material.
STRETCH2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Shows effort. Represents straightening or extending one's body or a part of one's body.

POINTINDEX.Orientation: Palm faces down or to the side.
POINTINDEX.Movement: The hand moves forward slightly to indicate a direction, person, or object.
POINTINDEX.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused gaze. Represents the action of indicating with the index finger.

TINY.Handshape: Dominant hand; G-Handshape (thumb and index finger extended parallel).
TINY.Movement: The thumb and index finger flick together, showing a very small amount.
TINY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Squinted eyes, 'eee' mouth morpheme. Represents something extremely small.

COINS.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
COINS.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
COINS.Movement: The dominant hand taps the non-dominant palm repeatedly in different spots.
COINS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents flat, round pieces of metal used as money.

WHISTLE2.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
WHISTLE2.Movement: The hand moves up and down slightly in front of the mouth.
WHISTLE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Lips are pursed, cheeks may be slightly puffed. Represents emitting a clear, high-pitched sound by forcing breath through the lips.

TRIANGLE.Movement: The hands move to trace the shape of a triangle in the air.
TRIANGLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a plane figure with three straight sides and three angles.

GETINBED.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
GETINBED.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
GETINBED.Movement: The dominant hand starts outside the non-dominant hand and moves down into the C-shape, as if tucking into covers.
GETINBED.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sleepy expression. Represents the action of lying down in bed.

CAKE.Handshape: Dominant hand; clawed 5-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
CAKE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
CAKE.Movement: The dominant hand rests on the non-dominant palm and moves up slightly, representing an item rising.
CAKE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a sweet baked food item.

COMB2.Location: Near the hair on the side of the head.
COMB2.Movement: The hand moves down through the hair with the fingers separated, as if using a comb.
COMB2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a strip of plastic or metal with teeth, used for grooming hair.

DUCK2.Handshape: Dominant hand; thumb, index, and middle fingers are extended and held together.
DUCK2.Movement: The fingers and thumb open and close twice, like a bill.
DUCK2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a waterfowl with a broad flat bill.

BLINDS2.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point to the sides.
BLINDS2.Location: In front of the body, one hand above the other.
BLINDS2.Movement: Both hands twist at the wrists simultaneously, pivoting the fingers up and down.
BLINDS2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents window coverings with slats that open and close.

CHEER.Movement: The hands shake vigorously, as if holding and shaking pompoms.
CHEER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Energetic, enthusiastic expression. Represents shouting encouragement or praise.

GRAMMAR.Handshape: Both hands; G-Handshapes (thumb and index finger parallel).
GRAMMAR.Movement: The hands start apart and move together, twisting inward at the wrists as they meet.
GRAMMAR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the system and structure of a language.

OFFEND.Movement: The fingertip starts at the non-dominant side of the chest and moves across to the dominant side with a sharp, jabbing motion.
OFFEND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Offended, hurt facial expression. Represents causing someone to feel upset or annoyed.

SKI.Movement: The hands move forward and back in an alternating motion, as if using poles.
SKI.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body leans forward, eyes focused ahead. Represents traveling over snow on long, narrow runners.

ERUPT2.Handshape: Both hands; start as S-Handshapes (fists) and burst open into clawed 5-Handshapes.
ERUPT2.Orientation: Start with palms facing each other.
ERUPT2.Location: In front of the body, starting close together.
ERUPT2.Movement: The hands move rapidly up and outward while opening forcefully.
ERUPT2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): 'pow' or 'cha' mouth morpheme. Represents an explosion, as from a volcano.

PRETEND.Movement: The hand makes small circles near the forehead, without touching.
PRETEND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or playful expression. Represents imagining something that is not real.

WASH2.Handshape: Both hands; open A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
WASH2.Location: In front of the body at chest level.
WASH2.Movement: The hands rub together in a circular or back-and-forth motion.
WASH2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of cleaning something with water and soap.

FOREVER1.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as Index-Handshape, transitions to Y-Handshape.
FOREVER1.Movement: The Index-Handshape touches the forehead, then moves forward while changing to a Y-Handshape.
FOREVER1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a limitless duration of time.

SELECT.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as open 5-Handshape, closes with thumb and index finger pinching.
SELECT.Orientation: Palm faces forward or to the side.
SELECT.Movement: The hand moves toward an imaginary object while the thumb and index finger pinch together, as if picking it out.
SELECT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused, choosing expression. Represents carefully choosing something as being the best.

COOPERATE.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes, linked by index fingers and thumbs.
COOPERATE.Movement: The linked hands move in a small horizontal circle.
COOPERATE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Cooperative expression. Represents working jointly toward the same end.

SLIPPER.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
SLIPPER.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SLIPPER.Movement: The dominant hand slides forward into the space between the thumb and index finger of the non-dominant hand.
SLIPPER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a comfortable slip-on shoe worn indoors.

BRA3.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point toward each other.
BRA3.Movement: The hands start at the center of the chest and move out to the sides, outlining the shape of the garment.
BRA3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents an undergarment worn by women to support the breasts.

PEEL2.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; S-Handshape (a fist).
PEEL2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
PEEL2.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the top of the non-dominant fist and moves down and away with a twisting motion.
PEEL2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents removing the outer covering or skin from a fruit or vegetable.

SHOVEL2.Location: Low in front of the body.
SHOVEL2.Movement: The hands move forward and up in a scooping motion, as if lifting material.
SHOVEL2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Shows effort. Represents a tool for digging and moving loose material.

APART.Handshape: Both hands; B-Handshapes (flat hands) or cupped 5-hands.
APART.Movement: The hands start together and move apart horizontally.
APART.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents being separated by a distance.

CATCH2.Handshape: Dominant hand; C-Handshape that closes to an S-handshape.
CATCH2.Movement: The hand starts open and moves forward while closing quickly, as if grabbing an object.
CATCH2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents intercepting and holding something which has been thrown.

BLACKBIRD.Handshape: First part: Index-hand. Second part: G-handshape.
BLACKBIRD.Orientation: Index-hand palm faces inward. G-hand palm faces to the side.
BLACKBIRD.Location: First at the forehead, then at the mouth.
BLACKBIRD.Movement: The index finger brushes across the forehead, then the G-handshape opens and closes at the mouth.
BLACKBIRD.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific type of bird that is dark in color.

PROPELLER.Handshape: Dominant hand; '3' Handshape (thumb, index, middle fingers extended). Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape.
PROPELLER.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
PROPELLER.Movement: The thumb of the dominant hand rests on the tip of the non-dominant index finger, and the dominant hand spins rapidly.
PROPELLER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May be accompanied by a 'whirring' sound. Represents a mechanical device with rotating blades.

JEALOUS.Location: At the corner of the mouth.
JEALOUS.Movement: The hand twists back and forth at the corner of the mouth.
JEALOUS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Jealous, envious facial expression. Represents feeling or showing envy of someone or their achievements.

NOTYET.Location: At the side of the body.
NOTYET.Movement: The hand shakes back and forth from the wrist repeatedly.
NOTYET.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Negative headshake. Represents something that has not happened up to the present time.

DRIP.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as an S-Handshape and flicks index finger down.
DRIP.Movement: The index finger flicks down repeatedly from the fist.
DRIP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a liquid falling in small drops.

MONSTER.Location: At the sides of the head.
MONSTER.Movement: The hands are held up like claws and may shake slightly.
MONSTER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Monstrous, frightening facial expression. Represents an imaginary creature that is typically large and frightening.

SEEM.Movement: The hand arcs forward and twists slightly from the wrist.
SEEM.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Thoughtful or uncertain expression. Represents giving the impression of being something or having a quality.

QUIT.Handshape: Dominant hand; H-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
QUIT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side, forming an opening.
QUIT.Movement: The dominant hand starts inside the opening of the non-dominant hand and pulls straight out.
QUIT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Firm, decisive expression. Represents leaving a job or ceasing an activity.

BANK.Handshape: Dominant hand; transitions through the handshapes for 'B', 'N', and 'K'.
BANK.Location: In neutral space in front of the shoulder.
BANK.Movement: The hand forms each letter in a quick, smooth sequence.
BANK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a financial institution.

GETTHROUGH.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
GETTHROUGH.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side, fingers pointing up.
GETTHROUGH.Movement: The dominant hand starts behind the non-dominant hand and moves forward, passing between the middle and ring fingers.
GETTHROUGH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Determined expression. Represents succeeding in passing through an obstacle or period.

SANTA.Location: At the chin and upper chest.
SANTA.Movement: The hands start at the chin and move down in arcs, outlining a large beard.
SANTA.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Jolly expression, 'ho ho ho' mouth movement. Represents the figure associated with Christmas.

STRING.Movement: The hands start with pinkies touching and move apart horizontally.
STRING.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents material consisting of threads twisted together.

SIT.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent U-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; U-Handshape held horizontally.
SIT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
SIT.Movement: The dominant hand moves down to rest its fingertips across the fingers of the non-dominant hand.
SIT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents adopting or being in a position in which one's weight is supported by one's buttocks.

MARIONETTE.Handshape: Both hands; X-Handshapes with fingers pointing down.
MARIONETTE.Location: Held high in front of the body.
MARIONETTE.Movement: The hands move up and down slightly, as if manipulating strings.
MARIONETTE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a puppet worked from above by strings attached to its limbs.

BUS.Handshape: Dominant hand; transitions through the handshapes for 'B', 'U', and 'S'.
BUS.Location: In neutral space in front of the shoulder.
BUS.Movement: The hand forms each letter in a quick, smooth sequence.
BUS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road.

EARLY.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with middle finger bent forward. Non-dominant hand; B-handshape (flat hand).
EARLY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
EARLY.Movement: The dominant middle finger slides from the wrist to the middle of the non-dominant palm.
EARLY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents happening or done before the usual or expected time.

BELIEVE2.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
BELIEVE2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
BELIEVE2.Movement: The index finger starts at the forehead, moves down, and clasps hands with the non-dominant hand.
BELIEVE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sincere, firm expression. Represents accepting something as true.

FIT.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes (thumb and index finger touch).
FIT.Movement: The hands start apart and move together until the fingertips interlock.
FIT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents being of the right shape and size for someone or something.

BLESS.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes with thumbs extended.
BLESS.Movement: The hands start at the mouth and move forward and down in arcs while opening slightly.
BLESS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Gentle, benevolent expression. Represents conferring wellbeing or divine favor upon someone.

FUN.Handshape: Dominant hand; H-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; H-Handshape.
FUN.Movement: The dominant hand starts at the nose and moves down to brush against the non-dominant hand.
FUN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Smiling, amused expression. Represents enjoyment, amusement, or lighthearted pleasure.

GATECLOSE.Orientation: Palms face inward, fingertips point forward.
GATECLOSE.Movement: The hands start apart and move together until the fingertips meet.
GATECLOSE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of closing a hinged barrier.

SHUTOUT.Movement: The hands start apart and move together quickly and firmly, meeting in the middle.
SHUTOUT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Firm, decisive expression. Represents preventing an opponent from scoring in a game.

RESTLESS.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
RESTLESS.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
RESTLESS.Movement: The dominant hand turns back and forth repeatedly on the non-dominant palm.
RESTLESS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Restless facial expression, body may fidget. Represents being unable to rest or relax due to anxiety or boredom.

INSTEAD.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes (thumb and index finger touch).
INSTEAD.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down, non-dominant palm faces up.
INSTEAD.Movement: The dominant hand starts above the non-dominant hand, moves down to touch it, then moves up and forward in an arc.
INSTEAD.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents something as an alternative to another.

IMPRESS.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
IMPRESS.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces inward.
IMPRESS.Movement: The dominant thumb starts on the non-dominant palm (near the chest) and presses forward firmly.
IMPRESS.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Impressed facial expression. Represents making someone feel admiration and respect.

NOBIGDEAL.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes (thumb and index finger touch).
NOBIGDEAL.Movement: The hands shake back and forth slightly from the wrists.
NOBIGDEAL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Casual, dismissive expression; may shrug shoulders. Represents something not being important or significant.

AT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces forward. Non-dominant palm faces inward.
AT.Movement: The dominant hand moves forward and makes contact with the back of the stationary non-dominant hand.
AT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents expressing location or arrival in a particular place.

TAKENOTES.Handshape: Dominant hand; modified X-handshape (as if holding a pen). Non-dominant hand; B-handshape (flat hand).
TAKENOTES.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
TAKENOTES.Movement: The dominant hand makes several short writing motions across the non-dominant palm.
TAKENOTES.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents writing down points or ideas from a lecture or text.

DOG4.Location: At the side of the upper thigh.
DOG4.Movement: The hand pats the thigh, often followed by snapping the fingers.
DOG4.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression, may include a tongue click. Represents a canine animal.

OPINION2.Movement: The hand moves in a small circle near the forehead.
OPINION2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Thoughtful expression. Represents a view or judgment formed about something.

PERSUADE.Movement: The hands start forward and move back toward the body while closing slightly, as if gently pulling someone.
PERSUADE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Persuasive facial expression. Represents causing someone to do something through reasoning or argument.

CONFIDENTIAL.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended.
CONFIDENTIAL.Movement: The thumbnail taps the lips twice.
CONFIDENTIAL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Secretive expression, may include a 'shhh' gesture. Represents something intended to be kept secret.

RETIRE.Handshape: Both hands; R-Handshapes (index and middle fingers crossed).
RETIRE.Location: At the sides of the chest.
RETIRE.Movement: Both hands tap the chest simultaneously twice.
RETIRE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or pleasant expression. Represents leaving one's job and ceasing to work.

VALLEY.Location: Start high and apart in front of the body.
VALLEY.Movement: The hands move down and toward each other, then move horizontally, outlining the shape of a low area between hills.
VALLEY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a low area of land between hills or mountains.

MIDDLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent 5-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
MIDDLE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
MIDDLE.Movement: The dominant hand moves in a horizontal circle and then the middle fingertip taps the center of the non-dominant palm.
MIDDLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the point or position at an equal distance from the sides or edges.

DOCTOR2.Handshape: Dominant hand; D-Handshape (index finger extended, other fingers and thumb form a circle).
DOCTOR2.Movement: The fingertips of the dominant hand tap the non-dominant wrist twice, as if taking a pulse.
DOCTOR2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or professional expression. Represents a qualified practitioner of medicine.

PEG3.Handshape: Dominant hand; G-Handshape (thumb and index finger parallel).
PEG3.Movement: The hand makes a pinching motion downward.
PEG3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a small clip for fastening clothes to a line.

ADDICT.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
ADDICT.Location: At the corner of the mouth.
ADDICT.Movement: The hand moves toward the mouth and hooks onto the corner.
ADDICT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Addicted, craving expression. Represents being compulsively committed to a particular substance or activity.

MODEL2.Handshape: Both hands; Y-Handshapes (thumb and pinky extended).
MODEL2.Movement: The hands hang loosely and twist back and forth from the wrists.
MODEL2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a person employed to display clothing or other merchandise.

FROWN1.Movement: The hands start above the eyebrows and move down and together, drawing the eyebrows down.
FROWN1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A furrowed brow and downturned mouth. Represents furrowing one's brow in an expression of disapproval or unhappiness.

POOP.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended. Non-dominant hand; S-Handshape.
POOP.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces down.
POOP.Movement: The dominant thumb starts inside the non-dominant fist and moves downward.
POOP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents feces or the act of defecation.

PUNISH.Movement: The dominant hand moves down sharply, striking the non-dominant elbow as the non-dominant arm is held across the body.
PUNISH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Stern expression. Represents inflicting a penalty for an offense.

REGULAR.Movement: The dominant hand starts above the non-dominant hand and taps down on it twice while moving forward.
REGULAR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents occurring or recurring at uniform intervals.

FEED1.Movement: The hands move forward and back in an alternating motion, as if giving food.
FEED1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or nurturing expression. Represents giving food to someone or something.

BED2.Location: At the side of the head, near the cheek.
BED2.Movement: The hand pats the side of the head as the head tilts onto it.
BED2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Head tilts, eyes may close. Represents a piece of furniture used for sleep or rest.

JEWISH.Movement: The hand starts at the chin and moves down slightly while closing, representing a beard.
JEWISH.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents relating to Jews or Judaism.

CURTSEY1.Handshape: Dominant hand; bent V-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
CURTSEY1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
CURTSEY1.Movement: The dominant hand 'stands' on the non-dominant palm, then bends its 'knees' slightly.
CURTSEY1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Respectful expression. Represents a formal gesture of respect made by women.

PICK.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as open 5-Handshape, closes with thumb and index finger pinching.
PICK.Orientation: Palm faces to the side or down.
PICK.Movement: The hand moves toward an imaginary object while the thumb and index finger pinch together.
PICK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused, choosing expression. Represents choosing or selecting something.

HONOR.Movement: The hands start near the forehead and move forward and down in respectful arcs.
HONOR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Respectful expression, head may bow slightly. Represents holding someone or something in high regard.

GUN3.Location: In neutral space, held out from the body.
GUN3.Movement: The index finger bends down as the thumb moves up, as if a hammer on a firearm.
GUN3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused, intense expression. Represents a weapon that propels bullets.

OFFTHEPOINT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up or inward.
OFFTHEPOINT.Movement: The dominant index fingertip starts at the stationary non-dominant index fingertip and moves off to the side.
OFFTHEPOINT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or dismissive expression. Represents deviating from the main subject.

LIST.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
LIST.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
LIST.Movement: The dominant hand makes several short chopping motions down the length of the non-dominant palm, from heel to fingertips.
LIST.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a number of connected items written or printed consecutively.

MASCARA.Handshape: Dominant hand; X-Handshape (index finger is hooked).
MASCARA.Movement: The hooked index finger moves up along the eyelashes, as if applying cosmetic.
MASCARA.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Eyes look up slightly. Represents a cosmetic for darkening and thickening the eyelashes.

SWEEP.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
SWEEP.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SWEEP.Movement: The dominant hand brushes across the non-dominant palm from heel to fingertips, twice.
SWEEP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents cleaning an area by brushing away dirt or litter.

DRILL.Handshape: Dominant hand; L-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape.
DRILL.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces up.
DRILL.Movement: The dominant index finger rests on the non-dominant palm and twists back and forth rapidly.
DRILL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May be accompanied by a drilling sound. Represents a tool or machine with a rotating cutting tip.

FOLD2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
FOLD2.Movement: The dominant hand flips over onto the non-dominant palm, as if folding something in half.
FOLD2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents bending something over on itself.

RHINO3.Handshape: Dominant hand; Y-Handshape (thumb and pinky extended).
RHINO3.Movement: The hand starts with the pinky at the nose and moves forward and up in an arc.
RHINO3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a large mammal with one or two horns on the nose.

PANTS2.Movement: Both hands brush down the legs simultaneously.
PANTS2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents trousers or slacks.

WRISTWATCH3.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch, forming a circle).
WRISTWATCH3.Location: At the back of the non-dominant wrist.
WRISTWATCH3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression, eyes may glance at the wrist. Represents a small timepiece worn on a strap.

SHINY.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward. Non-dominant hand; B-handshape.
SHINY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SHINY.Movement: The dominant middle finger touches the back of the non-dominant hand and moves up while wiggling.
SHINY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Bright, sparkling expression. Represents reflecting light, typically because smooth or polished.

MAIL1.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
MAIL1.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward. Non-dominant palm faces up.
MAIL1.Movement: The thumb of the dominant hand touches the lips, then moves down to touch the non-dominant palm.
MAIL1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents letters and parcels sent by post.

WINK.Handshape: Dominant hand; G-Handshape (thumb and index finger parallel).
WINK.Location: At the side of the eye.
WINK.Movement: The hand twists quickly from the wrist.
WINK.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): One eye closes briefly. Represents closing and opening one eye quickly as a signal.

STEP.Movement: The hands move forward in an alternating, step-like motion.
STEP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents lifting and setting down one's foot as in walking.

GRASP.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as open 5-Handshape, closes to S-handshape.
GRASP.Movement: The hand moves forward quickly and closes firmly into a fist, as if seizing something.
GRASP.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents seizing and holding something firmly.

WAND.Orientation: Palm faces forward or to the side.
WAND.Movement: The hand moves in a waving or swirling motion.
WAND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Mystical expression. Represents a slender stick held by a magician or fairy.

REQUEST.Orientation: Palms face each other, fingertips point up.
REQUEST.Movement: The hands start forward and move back toward the body while bending slightly inward.
REQUEST.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleading or polite expression. Represents an act of asking politely or formally for something.

BACHELOR.Movement: The hand touches one side of the chin, then moves across to touch the other side.
BACHELOR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a man who is not and has never been married.

GRIEVE.Handshape: Both hands; A-Handshapes (fists with thumbs alongside).
GRIEVE.Movement: The hands twist inward toward each other over the heart.
GRIEVE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sad, pained facial expression. Represents feeling intense sorrow.

LIGHTNING.Movement: The hand moves down quickly in a zigzag path.
LIGHTNING.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or startled expression. Represents a natural electrical discharge in the atmosphere.

PRIEST.Handshape: Dominant hand; G-Handshape (thumb and index finger parallel).
PRIEST.Movement: The hand moves horizontally across the neck, representing a clerical collar.
PRIEST.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, formal expression. Represents an ordained minister in certain Christian churches.

SUMMARIZE.Handshape: Both hands; start as open 5-Handshapes and close to S-Handshapes.
SUMMARIZE.Location: In front of the body, starting apart.
SUMMARIZE.Movement: The hands start apart and move together while closing into fists.
SUMMARIZE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents giving a brief statement of the main points.

BUY.Handshape: Dominant hand; flat O-Handshape (fingers curved to meet the thumb). Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
BUY.Orientation: Dominant palm faces up. Non-dominant palm faces up.
BUY.Movement: The back of the dominant hand rests on the non-dominant palm and moves forward in a short arc.
BUY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents obtaining something in exchange for payment.

DARK2.Movement: The hands start apart at the sides and move inward, crossing in front of the face.
DARK2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the absence of light.

GRAB.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as open 5-Handshape, closes quickly to S-handshape.
GRAB.Orientation: Palm faces to the side or down.
GRAB.Movement: The hand moves forward quickly and closes firmly into a fist.
GRAB.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused expression. Represents seizing something suddenly and roughly.

GAMBLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended.
GAMBLE.Movement: The thumb flicks forward from behind the fingers, as if shooting dice.
GAMBLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Risky expression. Represents playing games of chance for money; betting.

TURBAN.Movement: The hands start at the forehead and wrap around the head toward the back.
TURBAN.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a man's headdress consisting of a long length of cotton or silk wound around the head.

MOTIVATION2.Movement: The hands rub back and forth against each other in a circular or linear motion.
MOTIVATION2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Energetic, eager expression. Represents a reason for action or a drive to succeed.

TTY.Handshape: Dominant hand; transitions through the handshapes for 'T', 'T', and 'Y'.
TTY.Location: In neutral space in front of the shoulder.
TTY.Movement: The hand forms each letter in a quick, smooth sequence.
TTY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a teletypewriter, a device for text communication over telephone lines.

EXPECT.Orientation: Dominant palm faces inward; non-dominant palm faces down.
EXPECT.Location: At the side of the forehead.
EXPECT.Movement: The dominant hand starts above the non-dominant hand, and both bend down from the knuckles twice.
EXPECT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Hopeful, expectant facial expression. Represents regarding something as likely to happen.

BELL.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
BELL.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
BELL.Movement: The dominant hand moves side to side, striking the inside of the non-dominant hand like a clapper.
BELL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a hollow metal object that makes a ringing sound when struck.

SMELLMONEY.Movement: The hand moves up toward the nose twice, as if sniffing.
SMELLMONEY.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Inhaling motion through the nose. Represents perceiving an opportunity for financial gain.

HALLOWEEN2.Movement: The hands start covering the eyes, then move away slightly and snap back quickly.
HALLOWEEN2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or playful expression. Represents a holiday celebrated on October 31st.

SHARP2.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward. Non-dominant hand; B-handshape (flat hand).
SHARP2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SHARP2.Movement: The dominant middle finger flicks off the edge of the non-dominant hand.
SHARP2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents having a thin cutting edge or a fine point.

DRUG.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended.
DRUG.Movement: The thumb jabs into the bicep twice.
DRUG.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a medicine or other substance which has a physiological effect.

PREDICT.Handshape: Dominant hand; V-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
PREDICT.Movement: The hand moves forward under the non-dominant B-hand held flat.
PREDICT.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Focused, anticipating expression. Represents saying or estimating that a specified thing will happen.

SHAVE5.Orientation: The thumb-side of the hand is against the cheek.
SHAVE5.Location: On the side of the face, along the jawline.
SHAVE5.Movement: The hand moves down the cheek in two short, repeated motions.
SHAVE5.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression, head may be tilted. Represents the action of removing hair with a razor.

OPTION.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with middle finger and thumb pinching.
