OPTION.Movement: The hand moves back and forth between two points, tapping the thumb and middle finger together at each point.
OPTION.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or thoughtful expression. Represents a thing that is or may be chosen.

RAINBOW.Handshape: Dominant hand; 4-Handshape (four fingers extended, thumb tucked in).
RAINBOW.Location: Starts high on the non-dominant side.
RAINBOW.Movement: The hand moves in a large arc from one side to the other, ending low on the dominant side.
RAINBOW.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Pleasant expression. Represents an arc of colors visible in the sky.

VALUE.Handshape: Both hands; V-Handshapes (index and middle fingers extended).
VALUE.Movement: The hands start apart and move down and together, tapping fingertips.
VALUE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the regard that something is held to deserve; importance or worth.

BOYFRIEND.Handshape: First part: Dominant C-hand. Second part: Both Index-hands.
BOYFRIEND.Orientation: C-hand palm to side. Index-hands one palm up, one palm down.
BOYFRIEND.Location: First at forehead, then in front of body.
BOYFRIEND.Movement: The C-hand taps the forehead, then the Index-hands hook together.
BOYFRIEND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Affectionate expression. Represents a male romantic partner.

POPE.Movement: The hands start at the temples and move back, outlining a tall hat.
POPE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the head of the Roman Catholic Church.

FLAG2.Handshape: Dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand). Non-dominant arm is held upright.
FLAG2.Movement: The dominant elbow rests on the non-dominant hand, and the dominant hand waves back and forth.
FLAG2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a piece of cloth attached to a pole as a symbol.

TRANSGENDER.Handshape: Dominant hand; starts as open 5-handshape and closes, middle finger and thumb touching.
TRANSGENDER.Movement: The hand starts at the heart, moves out, twists, and moves back toward the heart.
TRANSGENDER.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents denoting a person whose sense of personal identity does not correspond with the sex assigned at birth.

FEED2.Movement: The hands move forward and back in an alternating motion, as if giving food.
FEED2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or nurturing expression. Represents giving food to someone or something.

YES.Location: In neutral space in front of the shoulder.
YES.Movement: The hand pivots up and down from the wrist, like a nodding head.
YES.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Affirmative head nod. Represents a positive affirmation or agreement.

INTERPRET.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes (thumb and index finger touch).
INTERPRET.Movement: The hands are held with fingertips touching and twist back and forth in opposition from the wrists.
INTERPRET.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral, focused expression. Represents explaining the meaning of information or actions.

SOFTBALL.Movement: The hands start apart and come together, tapping fingertips twice.
SOFTBALL.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a modified form of baseball played with a larger ball.

WHEELCHAIR.Handshape: Both hands; T-Handshapes (thumb tucked between index and middle fingers).
WHEELCHAIR.Location: At the sides of the body.
WHEELCHAIR.Movement: The hands move forward in alternating circles, representing wheels.
WHEELCHAIR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a chair fitted with wheels for use by sick or disabled people.

LIFT1.Location: Starts low in front of the body.
LIFT1.Movement: Both hands move straight up together.
LIFT1.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May show effort. Represents raising something to a higher position.

BITE2.Location: On the non-dominant arm or hand.
BITE2.Movement: The dominant hand moves toward the non-dominant arm and closes its shape sharply, as if biting.
BITE2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): May show teeth slightly. Represents using the teeth to cut into something.

SHORTPERSON.Location: Low in front of the body.
SHORTPERSON.Movement: The hand is held stationary at a low height.
SHORTPERSON.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a person of less than average height.

ROW.Location: At the sides of the body.
ROW.Movement: The hands move back and forth in alternating circular motions, as if rowing a boat.
ROW.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Body leans with the motion. Represents propelling a boat with oars.

NECKLACE3.Orientation: Palms face down, fingertips point toward each other.
NECKLACE3.Location: At the upper chest, near the collarbones.
NECKLACE3.Movement: The hands start apart and move in an arc toward each other, tracing the shape of the jewelry.
NECKLACE3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a piece of jewelry worn around the neck.

HITCHHIKE.Handshape: Dominant hand; A-Handshape with thumb extended.
HITCHHIKE.Orientation: Palm faces forward or to the side.
HITCHHIKE.Location: Held out at the side of the body.
HITCHHIKE.Movement: The hand jerks the thumb upward or moves the arm slightly back and forth.
HITCHHIKE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents soliciting a free ride by standing at the edge of a road.

INSIDE.Handshape: Dominant hand; flat O-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; C-Handshape.
INSIDE.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
INSIDE.Movement: The dominant hand moves down into the opening of the non-dominant hand.
INSIDE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the inner side or surface of something.

TURNAROUND.Orientation: Palm faces down, fingertip points forward.
TURNAROUND.Movement: The hand makes a 180-degree turn horizontally.
TURNAROUND.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents the action of moving so as to face in the opposite direction.

PIPE4.Handshape: Both hands; F-Handshapes (thumb and index finger touch, forming a circle).
PIPE4.Movement: The hands start together and move apart horizontally, tracing the shape of a cylinder.
PIPE4.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a hollow cylinder.

KNOWNOTHING.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Clueless, blank facial expression. Represents having no knowledge or information.

HAIRDRYER3.Handshape: Dominant hand; L-Handshape, bent (index finger and thumb extended, other fingers curled in).
HAIRDRYER3.Location: Held in the space beside the head.
HAIRDRYER3.Movement: The hand moves back and forth slightly.
HAIRDRYER3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Cheeks are slightly puffed. Conceptually represents an appliance that blows hot air.

HUMOR.Handshape: Dominant hand; H-Handshape (index and middle fingers extended).
HUMOR.Movement: The fingertips brush down and off the tip of the nose twice.
HUMOR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): A smiling or laughing expression. Represents the quality of being amusing or comic.

DRIBBLE.Movement: The hand makes repeated short, downward tapping motions, as if bouncing a ball.
DRIBBLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents bouncing a ball repeatedly.

PICKLE.Handshape: Dominant hand; K-Handshape (index and middle fingers point up, thumb on middle finger).
PICKLE.Movement: The hand twists back and forth at the chin.
PICKLE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a cucumber that has been preserved in brine or vinegar.

SPREAD3.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
SPREAD3.Movement: The dominant hand moves back and forth over the non-dominant palm, as if spreading a substance.
SPREAD3.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents opening something out over a larger area.

VISION.Handshape: Both hands; V-Handshapes (index and middle fingers extended).
VISION.Movement: The hands start at the eyes and move forward and apart in arcs.
VISION.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Thoughtful expression. Represents the faculty or state of being able to see, or an imagined mental image.

MAJOR.Movement: The dominant hand starts behind the non-dominant hand and moves forward along its edge.
MAJOR.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a principal field of study for a student.

CANCEL2.Handshape: Dominant hand; Index-Handshape. Non-dominant hand; B-Handshape (flat hand).
CANCEL2.Orientation: Dominant palm faces down. Non-dominant palm faces up.
CANCEL2.Movement: The dominant index finger draws an 'X' across the non-dominant palm.
CANCEL2.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral or negative expression. Represents deciding that an arranged event will not take place.

SENSITIVE.Handshape: Dominant hand; '5' handshape with the middle finger bent forward.
SENSITIVE.Movement: The middle finger flicks up off the shoulder or chest.
SENSITIVE.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Sensitive, possibly pained expression. Represents being quick to detect or respond to slight changes or influences.

BURY4.Movement: The hands move forward and apart in a digging motion, as if pushing soil over something.
BURY4.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents putting something into the ground and covering it.

STRAWBERRY4.Handshape: Dominant hand; F-Handshape (thumb and index finger touch). Non-dominant hand; Index-Handshape.
STRAWBERRY4.Orientation: Dominant palm faces to the side. Non-dominant palm faces to the side.
STRAWBERRY4.Movement: The dominant hand twists on the tip of the non-dominant index finger.
STRAWBERRY4.Others: Non-Manual Signal (NMS): Neutral expression. Represents a specific red, heart-shaped fruit.
